review: 6/10 - A relic from the past. The core gameplay is OK, with good variety of weapons and enemies, even though it gets repetitive at times. It is interesting to compare the design choices with modern horde survivors (e.g. Brotato and 20 Minutes Till Dawn). For example, the "flatter" perk and weapon system compared to Brotato means that we peak out much earlier and less strongly, but the much shorter runs (almost always under 3 minutes) balances this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052707118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1659900990}
review:
Wonderfull classic top down shooter from the devs of 'Neon Chrome'. Absolute must-buy classic.

While standing a little on the lower side in regards of graphics nowadays the gameplay still utterly sucks you in and gets you wanting to play that 'just one more go'. Tons of weapons and levels will keep you busy for a surprisingly long time and hard but realistic achievements will make you feel rewarded because most of them you really got to work for.

I totally recommend this game - even today - if you're a sucker for top down zombie shooters with rogue like elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004120981', 'num_games_owned': 9074, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 3140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3140, 'last_played': 1710195495}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
A very fun classic top-down shooter with a simple gameplay loop and variety of guns, perks, and game modes that runs perfectly on the Steam Deck.

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Simple fun
+ Still holds up
+ Works well on Deck

[b]Cons[/b]
- Repetitive

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Crimsonland is a fun classic old school top-down shooter with a nice simple gameplay loop, a large number of guns, perks, and power ups keeping each run interesting and challenging along with extra game modes to give some variety. The sound work is decent and the graphics still holds up. The game runs quite well on the Steam Deck and can run for hours.

[b]Notes[/b]
Started playing Crimsonland on PC years ago and booted it up again on the Steam Deck to finish it off. Can attest the game runs flawlessly on the Steam Deck and can be played for hours. Although there is 1 game mode where you need to type out words to shoot enemies and it is a little finicky to play on the Steam Deck.
The game also allows you to bring in 3 other people to play with but I have not gotten to try this as I am mostly a Solo player.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
There are multiple game modes and a quest mode which is basically a "story" mode with 3 different difficulties to be completed sequentially. Quests can be quite challenging especially at the higher difficulties, coupled with the randomness of weapon drops, perk choices, and in my experience completing them it seems there are some weapons or perks that are disabled for some levels making things much more of a challenge in the higher difficulties.
The multitude of modes gives a nice variety to gameplay allowing you to choose how you want to play at the moment. The most biggest draw to Crimsonland is really the classic survival mode that it originally came with before having all the extra modes added over time. The simplicity of the gameplay loop, trying to survive as long as you can picking up new or your favorite weapons, picking up power ups to quickly wipe enemies, and choosing new perks to help you survive longer to get the highest score possible.
You are provided with a basic pistol at the start of most game modes and pick up other guns as you kill enemies as drops. There are a significant number of weapons to choose from but they need to be unlocked first by completing levels in quest mode. Each gun shoots differently and some have different effects giving a range of options to choose from or just a choice in what gun would be your favorite you'll likely stick with and look for whenever you're going for a run.
Perks are also a big component of the game and need to be unlocked in quest mode just like guns. Unlike guns perks aren't found like drops but as you "level up" from killing enemies and racking up points you're given a random set of perks to choose from. Similarly there are a ridiculous amount of perks to unlock and choose from, some are situational while others are probably a staple that you'll always take as soon as they show up.

[b]Graphics & Sound[/b]
Crimsonland has a top-down view and decent graphics, other than being a pretty old game at this point it really doesn't need anything more than what it is. Enemies are obvious, pickups are easily seen, and everything moves smoothly from enemies to bullets. So it really still holds up probably for many years to come.
Audio work is on point with enemies being fairly obvious when they enter the arena so you know what is coming, while guns have unique sounds and are distinct from one another. Music is limited with only a few that loops but its inconsequential.

[hr][/hr]
If you find my reviews useful do follow my [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/11028547-Dods-Echo-Chamber/]Curator[/url][/b] page for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198930269208', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1705258221}
review:
Crimsonland is a worthy top-down shooter that, despite its initial simplicity, boasts considerable depth in its mechanics. Initially, the game may seem lacking in content, but as you progress through the campaign, it steadily introduces more and more content. Ultimately, the game offers a diverse experience, and its progression system opens up new possibilities for the player instead of simply increasing statistics, as many games with meta progression tend to do.

It might remind many of very popular game, Vampire Survivors, as there are indeed numerous similar elements. Both games involve destroying hordes of enemies with a top-down camera perspective. However, unlike Vampire Survivors, Crimsonland does not have auto-attacks, and in addition to movement, players must aim, shoot, and reload their weapons. This, in my opinion, makes Crimsonland more dependent on player skill than on building specific character builds, although build creation still plays important role, albeit not as significant as in Vampire Survivors.

In conclusion, I recommend Crimsonland to all fans of intense top-down arena shooters who prefer relying on pure gaming skill rather than intricately builds creation.

review: If you've never played this monumental piece of video game history, you might think it's a dumb, straightforward top-down shooter. But the truth is that this game has become a classic because of its clever game design. Unlike its modern brain-dead clones like Survivor.io, it requires your wits and agility, strategic perk selection and lots of shooting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198843449216', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1704283143}
review:
这应该是我接触的第一款电脑游戏（大概小学二三年级），那会还不懂电脑，只记得是我爸带我玩的，他操作上下左右，我就拿鼠标瞄准，每天晚上求着我爸带我去玩这个游戏，可能我爸都记不清还有这回事了，后来他也没和我玩过游戏了，不过我自己装电脑的时候，他陪我一起装到好晚。
后来到了四五年级，我跟我发小在他家笔记本电脑里面发现了这个游戏，我俩晚上就天天玩，最喜欢打那个会生崽的僵尸那一关，因为家长只允许玩一关，那关怪物会下崽我俩可以多玩会。
现在补票了，但是童年的快乐永远不会补上票了

author: {'steamid': '76561198276634938', 'num_games_owned': 10153, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 2665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2665, 'last_played': 1702287776}
review:
[h1]
别问 问就是童年

[/h1]

喔喔！和以前一样的感觉，和以前一样的味道，和以前一样的打法！还有比以前优化了的碎尸效果。
在我们的旧时代中，到底有多少游戏是不论多久都不愿意忘掉的？
不论放了多久，都仍然想要跟以前一模一样感觉去再打一遍的？
就是这么一个游戏，就因为它，我在日后的时光中玩遍了《孤单枪手》系列，玩遍了《R.I.P》系列，奋战过俄罗斯的《怒斩千军》，还耍过《邪灵入侵》，还有一堆那些记也记不起来名字的，最后一直到我被以撒的结合给彻底坑爹了我才缓下来劲。
可是！现在呢？今天呢？
好吧，就为这么一个简单的破游戏，我再一次就这么欲罢不能了……
你看你看！就因为它，让我激动得连好好地写个评测都不能了……
不在这废话了，我继续浴血奋战去了！！！杀啊！！！！！！

review:
An underrated survival-style top-down shooter that has been around for quite some time. This particular version of the game is updated/remastered compared to the older versions from long ago. Vampire Survivors is not the inventor of this genre. Great and well-worth the low price.

For fans of:
Any top-down shooter
Alien Shooter
Smash TV
Vampire Survivors
Halls of Torment
Geometry Wars

author: {'steamid': '76561197992510991', 'num_games_owned': 2611, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1701991272}
review:
Really good game, but I definitely wasted my time. It is too indie for my taste and not entertaining enough to enjoy. Gameplay is pretty good, very enjoyable killing zombies and spiders, and the variety of weapons is vast. The roguelite elements are a gimmick and not really necessary, but it can swing your playstayle favourably. A lot of the perks are very creative and I wish other games would do the same. I think quests is the worst part of the game but to be honest, without it there would be only maybe 4 hours of gameplay.

-Gameplay: It is a basic twin stick shooter with a very annoying enemy AI that will try to surround you. All you do is arena kill enemies and survive. Not really the most entertaining repetitive gameplay loop as enemies do not really get stronger, just more plentiful and get annoying special abilties. It is good for maybe 4 hours, gets insanely boring and repetitive after that. 

-Quests: It is possibly the most annoying part of the game. Pigeon-hole an excessively tedious process to get 100% achievements just to elongate the game. Basically they are padding the numbers for hours played by forcing you to play each quest three different times, each one being a bit more difficulty. Really pathetic and tedious.

-Weapons: If most games of similar genres had the amount this game has, we would be spoiled. It is such a fantastic experience being able to try all the guns because of the random gun drop mechanic. Simply each gun feels unique and enjoyable to use. Some feel terrible like the "Blowtorch" but it has its value one you know how to play well, like most other weapons which have situations were they excel. Frankly, you will want an area of effect gun that can destroy everything.

-Random Drops: You want to have a high score? Get the "Lucky" perk and just watch how "nukes" and other random drops will destroy your enemies. It is fun to get around 8 drops in a row but it gets less fun and more essential, to the point that you might not get a single drop and it will ruin your run. It is great mechanic but maybe show up too often.

-Roguelite: It is really not strong. Sure some perks are highly creative and I found them refreshing, the maximum level I ever got was lvl 10 maybe. There aren't really any builds you can make and there are obvious perks that are insanely strong like "poison bullet" and just this perk can beat every single Quest in the game. I find the roguelite elements to be very poor.

-Co-op: Bloody fantastic. Who knew controlling 2 controllers at a time is exactly how you are suppose to play this game? Most of the tedious achievements, just use a 2nd controller and it will make everything trivial. Having Co-op is fantastic and I would be playing this with friends if there was an interest. Great implementation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267574190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1703848268}
review:
Как сейчас помню то время, когда я впервые включил эту игру в компьютерном клубе...  Эхх...
Те, к то играл в Crimsonland хотя бы раз, согласятся со мной в том, что в представлении данная игра не нуждается, Кстати, я лишь в 2016-17 годах узнал, что у этой игры оказывается имеется вторая часть...

author: {'steamid': '76561198049042488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1701454561}
review:
Игра, запустив которую я перенёсся в беззаботное детство, к бате на работу, куда он иногда меня брал с собой. Пока он был занят, меня отводили к програмерам (IT-отдел, если по-нашему), где в зависимости от свободного компа я садился играть либо в NFS, либо в Crimsonland. И каждый раз я надеялся, что это будет именно вторая игра. 
Потому что это эталонный спинномозговой шутан с видом сверху, которых сейчас на мобилках полно. Однако тот самый Кримсон у меня всегда будет на первом месте. 
Тебе нужно просто зайти в меню, услышать этот мощнейший металлический запил и всё — это любовь. 

P.S. По ощущениям стало больше стволов и перков, чем в той версии, что была в детстве. За это разрабам отдельное спасибо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202437583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1700667208}
review:
As someone who grew up on the 2003 version, diving into this updated iteration was a nostalgic journey that surpassed my expectations.

First and foremost, the developers absolutely nailed the essence of the original. The fast-paced, adrenaline-pumping action that made the 2003 version so addictive is still very much alive in the new Crimsonland. The familiar top-down perspective, the relentless waves of enemies, and the arsenal of weapons that can only be described as 'satisfyingly destructive' – it's all there, and it's just as thrilling as I remember.

What struck me the most was the seamless integration of nostalgia with innovation. The game manages to preserve the core gameplay that made the original so beloved while introducing new features that enhance the overall experience. It's a delicate balance that 10tons has managed to strike exceptionally well.

As a fan of the original, the updated visuals and audio design triggered a wave of nostalgia. The revamped graphics breathe new life into familiar landscapes, and the updated soundtrack complements the chaos on the screen perfectly. It's a modernized trip down memory lane that retains the essence of what made the original special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030006913', 'num_games_owned': 6544, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1698522605}
review:
오소독스한 호드 서바이벌 슈팅 게임.

장점:
- 빈약해보이는 그래픽과 달리 의외로 폴리싱이 잘 되어 있다. 새 무기가 나오면 무조건 다음판에 첫 무기로 나온다던가.
- 호쾌하고 난이도가 크게 어렵지 않음.
- 기본에 아주 충실함.

단점:
- 도전과제가 좀 빡세다.
- 뭐 좀 해보려하면 스테이지가 클리어된다.
- 충돌 판정이 살짝 애매하다.

호드류 서바이벌의 기본을 아주 잘 지키고 있는 게임. 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217537739', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1697819532}
review: Really nice shoot' em up -game. Reminded me a bit of Phobia 2 from the late 90s. Has a campaign and many different survivor modes which give you something to do after finishing all the missions. I didn't go for harder difficulty after finishing the game but I would think it gives you some extra hours with the game. Most of the perks are useful and you don't always even pick the same ones. I would say it's worth the price too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155654639', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1698026869}
review: I played Tesla vs Lovecraft first, which is the sequel to this game.  I made the mistake of thinking this was a lesser version of it.  I'm really glad I played Crismsonland because at least one thing I disliked in TvL is actually in this game, in particular Health Perks.   Some of the maps are really tough, and require more luck than skill.  I generally don't like luck based games, but this game (and TvL) is different.  Even if you get a bit frustrated, it's still fun and challenging.

review:
非常刺激爽快并且上瘾的双摇杆射击神作，无聊的时候玩一把，普通难度打完还有专家难度，全打完还有隐藏玩法，总之是非常爽。
想获得成就就要无伤打过第一关，专家难度其实也不算太难。
几个特定成就不好达成，可以找个小伙伴开一下双人模式，很快就能达成了。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993551765', 'num_games_owned': 1076, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 26071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15971, 'last_played': 1711038115}
review:
Если коротко, то игра про корейский рандом и от скиллов игрока процесс практически не зависит. Можно записать в минусы, но энтропия тут довольно справедливая: удачная игра может быстро превратиться в неудачную. И наоборот. Как в камень-ножницы-бумага.

В целом норм. Я оригинал смутно помню, так что отпишусь без ностальгических очков.
Самая суть в игре это режимы выживания. Но нужно пройти "одиночную кампанию". Проходится за 30-60 минут, поэтому можно потерпеть. По ходу разлочишь все оружие и перки.
А потом начинается самое веселое - выживание. Было интересно подбирать тактику, чтобы продержаться подольше. Суть такова: [spoiler] если до 200-300к очков не нашел телекинез, то ты труп. На первых порах идеал это ионные пушки + заражение. Особенно хорошо против бесячих пауков, которые половинятся при смерти. А потом начинайте выискивать перк, усиливающий пламя огня и берите любой из дробовиков - я беру обрез или jackhammer. У первого разброс большой, у второго скорострельность. Потом нужны будут перки на спаун бонусов. повышенный уров во время замедления. Короче, под конец монстры просто забьют весь экран и у них будет много здоровья. И важжно постоянно подбирать бонус ускорения стрельбы и огненные пули. А потом что-то из трех: защитное поле, заморозку монстров или хотя бы замедление времени. Тогда просто постоянно будешь крошить монстров и набивать очки. 40 минут ушло на то, чтобы набить 200 млн в режиме "волны". [/spoiler]
В каком-то смысле это азартная игра, т.к. никогда не знаешь, какие перки дадут на выбор при прокачке, поэтому опасно :) а ведь интересно. Поубивать минут 30-40 самое оно.

author: {'steamid': '76561199144598749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1692504244}
review:
Prepare yourself for heart-pounding moments as you face off against awe-inspiring creatures in this game. The intensity of the encounters is nothing short of breathtaking, as you find yourself on the edge of your seat, heart racing, and palms sweaty, as you navigate through each heart-stopping showdown with these formidable foes.

One of the standout features of this game is the incredible variety of firearms at your disposal. The weapons range from classic to cutting-edge, and each firearm offers a distinct shooting experience.

After many years, I've found myself revisiting this game over and over again. It's timeless gameplay and immersive experience have kept me hooked, reminding me why it's a classic in its own right. Despite the passage of time, the thrill of the action, and the overall excitement remain as captivating as ever. This game has truly stood the test of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025948380', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1691604697}
review:
Играл еще в школе на мобилке. Перепрошел уже на пк, завершив все уровни на всех сложностях. Оружие классное, враги разнообразные, стрельба зачетная. Существенных багов практически нет. Однако после прохождения сюжета, когда открыл все навыки и стволы, ожидаешь лютого замеса в режимах… и тут игра мягко разочаровывает. Из обилия режимов, по сути, играбельных лишь два. Выживание и волны. Остальные режимы заканчиваются (если вы не читер) довольно быстро, без возможности как-то сильно изменить свой прежний результат. Да и режимы выживания не шибко уж и прекрасны. Слишком уж тошно и муторно необходимо мониторить всю карту на наличие бонусов; обязательно нужно вкачивать определенные навыки, чтобы продержаться долго; удачи с выпадением нормального оружия/навыков. Хп врагам вешают овер дох-ера слишком быстро. В общем, без особого вникания, а чисто на опыте, в выживании можно умудриться набить +- миллион. Для лютых задротов уже планка выше, ибо те точно знают что делают. Вместо радости и позитива - выживание приносит гнев и разочарование. 

Но игра мне все равно нравится из-за компании с уровнями. Рекомендую. 15 часов пролетят за глаза.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153216871', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1689522917}
review:
Ну что же, вот я наконец-то добрался до одного из основоположников, отцов, или как  бы наши англоговорящие товарищи выразились "OG", жанра shoot 'em up/top-down shooter
"Одного из", ибо у истоков стояла и вторая игра - Alien Shooter, с которой я знаком хорошо

Однако несмотря на общую похожесть концепции, Алиен скорее про прохождение собранных вручную сюжетных уровней, а вот Кримса, как бы я выразился, скорее про "рогаликовую" вариацию, где на первом плане разовые забеги, перки и т.д.

Важность этой игры еще заключается в том, что в данный момент у жанра происходит перерождение, запущенное горячо любимой мной Vampire Survivors, и вот без существования Кримсы мне кажется этого бы не случилось 

Что до самой игры - она чудесно проходит проверку временем!

Т.к. это считай полноценный ремейк, в релизных обзорах присутствует много критики относительно сомнительности ряда решений, которые впрочем, как я могу понять, разрабы со временем исправили/изменили
Ну и приятным бонусом является то, что в комплекте идет и оригинальная игра 2003-его, которую я советую пройти перед обновленной версией, она коротенькая, лично прошел ее часа за 4, после этого ремейк смотрится еще лучше

Да и ремейк это эталонный - освежили визуал, баланс, добавили даже не щепотку, а прилично так нового контента, и лично по моим ощущениям играть в обновку сильно приятнее, чем в оригинал

Вердикт - отличная игра, рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070629785', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 5474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3909, 'last_played': 1695387389}
review:
Crimsonland - это аркадный топ-даун шутер. Игра вышла в 2003 году, но получила переиздание в 2014 году с улучшенной графикой и новыми игровыми режимами.

Игровой процесс Crimsonland состоит из серии глав, каждая из которых состоит из нескольких волн врагов. Игрок должен уничтожать врагов и выживать по мере того, как волны становятся все сложнее и сложнее. В игре есть различные режимы, включая классический режим, режим выживания, режим "Миссии" и другие.

Одна из особенностей Crimsonland - это широкий выбор оружия. Игрок может использовать более 30 различных видов оружия, в том числе пистолеты, автоматы, ружья, лазерные пушки и многое другое. Кроме того, в игре есть различные бонусы, такие как ускорение, усиление оружия, дополнительное здоровье и т.д.

Графика в игре яркая и кровавая, что добавляет атмосферности и разнообразия. Кроме того, игра имеет хорошее музыкальное сопровождение, которое помогает создать напряженную атмосферу.

Общее впечатление от Crimsonland - это игра с простым, но захватывающим геймплеем, которая может заинтересовать любителей аркадных шутеров. Игра также поддерживает многопользовательский режим, что позволяет игрокам играть вместе или соревноваться друг с другом. Если вы любите аркадные шутеры, то Crimsonland стоит попробовать.

There are many games like this, but I definitely enjoyed this one a lot. Some top-down shooters get over-complicated, or you need a specific build to succeed. Crimsonland is pretty straightforward, but still very fun to play. 

I played for a little over 11 hours to 100% the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097949050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1707565246}
review:
“现在没有什么吸引我的新游戏玩，所以下班后我一直玩这个老游戏，直到上床睡觉。”
大概就是给人这种感受的老游戏，虽然对我来说符合这个标准的是dota2，但是起码，有那么一天下班，我没打dota，而是玩了一晚上血腥大地，直到上床睡觉。

author: {'steamid': '76561199072071809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1705603616}
review: Отличный шутер с видом сверху. Классика жанра. Шутер детства! Хорошо подходит, чтобы скоротать время. Идем от уровня к уровню и выносим тучи врагов с помощью большого количества разнообразных пушек, бонусов и способностей. И это все на трех уровнях сложности. Также можно заглянуть в разные игровые режим: выживание, волны, выполнение условий и т.д. Классно, если у вас есть гейпад – тогда и вдвоем с другом можно зарубиться (или сделать самое сложное на мой взгляд достижение Бабах)! Радует, что игру немного доделали, выпустили несколько обновлений, учли пожелания игроков, но сам геймплей остался неизменным – все как в старые добрые времена - адское месиво! Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561199037712628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1685092566}
review:
I was extremely wary of changes they made to my beloved game that I played for the better part of my life.
Finally bit the bullet and I'm happy to announce they hit the nail on the head.
All of the changes were for better. Things that were underutilized before got extra positives to become competitive.
This is an iterative improvement. I like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142712105', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1691327472}
review:
[h1] - "Vampire Survivors и Brotato, ваш батя погулять вышел." [/h1]

+ пушки
+ перки
+ много режимов игры
+ короткая
+ мультиплеер
+ вы приобретаете две версии игры за одну цену (2003 и её современный ремейк). между ними есть различия, каждый найдёт своё. Версия 2003 работает чуть ли не 1024х768, всё равно играбельна.
- первое оружие в раунде выпадает с первого убитого моба. предсказуемо, ближе к финальным уровням игры начинает работать фактор рандома. может выпасть имбаган (ракетный пистолет, любое гаусс-оружие), либо кал (огнемёт, самонаводящаяся ракетница, любое плазменное оружие)
- разделяющихся металлических пауков и розовых самок, спавнящих мелких быстрых таракашек придумал мазохист
- музыка... специфичная. Лучше свою включить на фон.
- уровни сложности открываются поочередно после [b]полного[/b] прохождения каждого...

author: {'steamid': '76561198052033507', 'num_games_owned': 3013, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1672188221}
review:
Хорошая игра, которая вроде как положила начало того, что теперь можно увидеть в известной игре про вампиров, где нет ни одного вампира. Однако эта игра не стала близка для меня. Всё будто слишком медленно и топорно. 

Это не первая игра от этих разработчиков, с которой я познакомился. У них талант делать хорошие идеи с посредственной реализацией. Мне просто стало скучно и я понял, что мне здесь больше делать нечего. 

Уверен, что многие любят эту игру, но я пройду мимо. Это не означает, что игра плохая, просто надоела.

review:
Recommend to busy people who have a lot of stress at work. Survival mode round lasts 5 minutes if you are very skillful, but in game you feel as if it was 20m.
And yes, blood, gore, hordes of zombies and ëasy to learn - hard to master included.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828680197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1673784340}
review:
Стандартный 2D шутер с видом сверху (top down), причем очень древний. Правда допилянный разработчиками до современных стандартом (там всякие поддержки геймпадов, разрешений и т.д.). До сих пор играется хорошо. Все те же волны монстров, все тот же ассортимент пушек, все те же глупые перки.
А вообще механика представляет собой стрельбу по всему, что движется. Для выживаемости необходимо подбирать нормальную пушку, под определенные волны (причем некоторые не годятся вообще ни для чего). Затем, как в каком-то рогалике, вылавливать необходимые перки. И наконец, бегать как заядлый спринтер по всей карте, стараясь никоим образом не попасть под волну прущих вражин. Хоть и интеллект их довольто тупой.
Игра до сих пор играется на ура. С тех самых пор, как ее только выпустили.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970786587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1784, 'last_played': 1702701132}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025780162', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 19629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18457, 'last_played': 1707863464}
review:
I play this game for literally over half of my life. I've started LOOONG before it appeared on Steam. I played it before Steam got even made. I played betas and early releases of it. I played it both alone and with my buddy. He's not in my life anymore, but Crimsonland still is. Crimsonland is better than friends. 
Crimsonland is benchmark of top down shooters. 
Crimsonland is life. 
Crimsonland is training on how to write on your keyboard fast (Type'o'Shooter mode). 
Crimsonland is so damn FUN.

Buy it. Play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198096281830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1621535343}
review:
Un juego de disparos en 2D que un principio parece uno más, pero cuando hablamos de desafíos es en medida cómo lo recuerdo, muy difícil por la manera en que te acorralan las criaturas, hay diferentes y hasta pueden ser imposibles los niveles si no tuvieras las armas o ventajas que sueltan, también hay habilidades, pero lo malo es que solo está en inglés, haciendo que tenga un público limitado ya que si no sabes, estarás escogiendo cualquier habilidad sin saber realmente qué hace.
El jugar con amigos no lo hará en esencia más fácil, sino todo lo contrario. 
Se centra principalmente en oleadas, careciendo de niveles interactivos o con estructuras, nada de historia, estarás en una zona abierta, expuesto, pero delimitada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055645863', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 9225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9113, 'last_played': 1700510991}
review:
A classic that created a genre. 

I've got a couple of gripes with this remaster - particularly not being able to save perks, some not working as intended (looking at you, stacking lean-mean-xp-machine), perks lacking in quest mode and no modding support - but otherwise, i'm quite happy to play this over the original. 

I find the visuals more crisp and clean, and I appreciate the reworks and balancing. 

The game's core is the endless survival mode, where you play for high-score. Enemies spawn in pseudo-waves, and every ~50k points a boss will spawn. Killing enemies drops weapons and power-ups, and score drives leveling which offers perks to increase your power. 

There's definitely a "meta" in order to get a high-score, consisting of both a good perk order, a good weapon (a shotgun-based), and understanding the super-late cycling of power-ups that is necessary in order to survive. 

I enjoyed Vampire Survivors, but I found it way too easy to complete, and disliked the lack of endless mode and high-scores. Crimsonland delivers on those.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090760979', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1669295900}
review:
一个魔性的游戏，物美价廉，打骨折时再买的话就像白送一样，堪称性价比之王。
只为过关的话不是很需要脑子，凭本能突突突就过去了，快感十分强烈。
后期想要做成就和收集完美通关的星星的话，可能稍微需要背板和碰运气，但这仍然是一个愉快的过程。

隐藏小游戏对我来说真难，应该是这款游戏唯一一个玩起来有点痛苦的部分了

author: {'steamid': '76561198015017393', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1590266998}
review:
Ahem. Allow me to make a grand entrance. I am the enigmatic gunslinger, the hero you never asked for but got anyway. Name? Unnecessary. Face? Overrated. Personality? Who needs it when you have guns and an endless horde of critters to blast?

I’m the silent warrior in this pixelated wasteland, hoarding power-ups like a dragon hoards treasure. My existence? Fleeting and entirely in your hands, oh mighty wielder of the controller.

So, what’s it going to be? Will you lead me to a blaze of glory, or am I destined to be just another forgotten sprite in the graveyard of digital dreams? Your move, puppet master. Don’t mess it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006619628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1835, 'last_played': 1672962288}
review:
Even though the first PC I've played this on is a long distant memory this has been my favourite game for instant glorious combat for almost two decades. It still holds up because it is extremely solid and satisfying. 

Note the video trailer is from a specific intense game-mode and doesn't quite reflect all games, I usually play Quest mode and it is less focussed on pickups and more about each quests enemy spawn setup, the random weapon of the round and the perks you choose to defeat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199052762267', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1698331833}
review:
Приветствую человека ,решившего читать сей обзор
Сегодня на повестке дня у нас Crimsonland

Знакомство:
О игре я узнал из видео на ютубе ,игра мне понравилась,но тогда я как человек ,не знавший о стиме и игровых магазинах 
Спустя год или два ,я как уже почётный пользователь STEAM искал TOP-Down Shooter , тогда я снова встретил эту игру ,а также легендарный Helldivers


Геймплей:
Ну он прост как кирпич.Ходи ,стреляй во врагов (Несколько рас) ,хватай баффы ,при повышении уровня выбирай перк .
Казалось бы ничего сложного,но в игре (в компании) есть уровни сложности ,а также звезды за прохождение уровня без урона.
В кампании всего 7 глав , 3 уровня сложности , ииииии...
Выживания .
Это самое интересное в игре.
Введена система соревнования в виде таблицы результатов
Всего в игре 7 выживаний:
1.Базовый
2.Натиск
3.Сбор оружия (по моему мнению один из интереснейших режимов)
4.Ядерное безумие ( один из сложнейших )
5.Разгром (он же блиц)
6.Волны
7.Typ'o'shooter


Оружие и перки:
Оружия :
1. Пулевые (одни из самых бесполезных )   
2. Дробовые (дробовики)
3. Оружия Гауса (очень мощное ,но медленное оружие)
4. Плазменное 
5. Ионное 
6. Огнемёты
7. Ракетницы / Гранатометы
8. Огнеметы 
9. Особое (все остальное)


Перки :
Перки можно поделить на полезные ,слабые/бесполезные , имбовые 
Есть перки дающие странные эффеткы ,хилящие ,отнимающие хп ,улучшающие оружие и тд.

Саундтрек :
Все прекрасно. Металл и рок ,но треков маловато.


Итог :
По цене 1 игры мы получаем 3 версии одной игры . С огромным арсеналом ,списком перков и разнообразие 
Моя оценка игре 10 из 10
Если вам ,Господа ,понравился мой обзор то приглашаю вас в группу http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ReviewsfromCompetitors
Также хочу порекомендовать вам свою группу : [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/lovecrafted] Hastur Reviews[/url]
Также рекомендую вам нашу новую группу, где кураторствую [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/solnyshki] Солнышки [/url]

P.S: если увидите, что я играю ,знайте я прохожу что либо без урона

review: Шикарная игра. Она как отличное порно, где действие лучше сюжета. Без спецэффектов, без шикарной 3д графики. Чисто химия между героем и актёрами второго плана в которых летят пули. Химия между огромным количеством несметных полчищ любителей трэша с ютуба, фуррифагов, нацистов, фемок, лгбт+, плоскоземельцев, представителей сотен гендеров, девочками оленями и выстрела с обреза в упор.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006450596', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1659725361}
review:
Сложно что-то писать про игру, которую застал ещё в момент её выхода совсем в другом виде, потом случайно наткнулся на неё же спустя несколько лет в совсем другом образе, а теперь ещё и тут поиграл. И да, она снова другая. Но всё такая же залипательная.
Хотите отключить мозг и просто пострелять - вот вам кампания на лёгкой сложности. Хотите вызова и лёгкого напряжения - вот вам кампании посложнее и прохождение без получения урона. Хотите, чтобы прямо порвало - вот выживание и мини-игра с комбинированием кристаллов. Хотя вот вам подсказка: отключив мозг, её можно пройти значительно проще, но оно того всё равно не стоит.
И сверху на всё это вывалена куча оружия и перков, сильно меняющих подход к процессу. Классика.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971123919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1702362093}
review:
Takes me back to high school, specifically English doubles. We'd sit at the back of the class and play the shit out of this game instead of.. learning how to spek gud.

Still has that same cathartic feel to it, the way projectiles hit enemies feels very good and the games pretty challenging and fun to boot.

Do wish I could've played Survival with all weapons unlocked, without having to play all the singleplayer content, felt a bit coercive, but hey it's an old game what you gonna do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198967888189', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1658826889}
review:
School desks eat up a large portion of your free time again, and would you therefore like to play on laptops while you compete with your classmates? Alternatively, you need to take a break from work, but you can't start anything new on your work laptop? Crimsonland could help you in both cases. It's a traditional top-down shooter that bets everything on well-mastered game mechanics, a huge number of levels, weapons and monsters, and bloody satisfying gameplay.

From the very beginning, Crimsonland doesn't play games. It doesn't bother you with the story, it doesn't overwhelm you with elaborate or complicated graphics, and mechanically it is as primitive as it can be. You control a character who has found himself in the middle of a situation from which it is only possible to shoot through. And so you shoot in all directions, because problems are coming at you from all sides. Blood sprays in geysers, limbs and other body parts fly through the air.
The individual missions of the "campaign" aren't just about waves of enemies mindlessly rushing at you. Rather, on the contrary, each of them is in a way planned in advance and functions as a certain form of challenge. Enemies appear in a predetermined composition and are also cleverly designed in terms of movement, reproduction and attack. It means that you have to play each mission in a different way, because the tactics you mastered in the last mission may not work completely in the next mission. And don't be fooled by simple visuals or game mechanics - Crimsonland is a really hard game. [b] 20% [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006687940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1658352830}
review:
Crimsonland is fun and to the point. It's a simple game. Shoot your way through hordes of undead, spiders, lizards, aliens and more. The game features a neat progression system, presenting the player either with a new weapon or a new perk after finishing a level. Guns range from assault rifles to ion cannons to rocket miniguns just to name a few. They blow up baddies good. The perks are fun as well and there's some neat synergy between perks and guns, like the perk angry reloader with a gun that has many & quick reloads. Besides the main quest there are several other game modes, like survival and rush. Even better, all game modes (even quest) are playable in max 4 player coop remote play (stream). Your friends don't need to buy the game, just send them a game invitation. Don't forget to activate their favoured methode of input in the Steam overlay.

I played Crimsonland way back before it was even released on Steam. To this day it's still as addicting as it was back then. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985000150', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 2582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1658300057}
review:
The classic top-down shooter is as good as you remember it being. I wish I hadn't held off for so long before buying it, there are plenty of levels and a good selection of modes. And it includes the original 2003 game too!
While the Quest mode is fun, the real challenge lies in the various Survival modes. Unfortunately not all of these are successful.  For example the weapon and perk pickup games are based entirely on the game deciding for you whether you're going to be allowed to live as you have no control over where the items spawn and what those items might be. It seems the game takes particular pleasure in never spawning a good weapon or speed perk when you really need one. 
The Waves and Blitz modes along with the traditional Survival mode are good though. 
You'll breeze through the Quest on the first two difficulty levels although some levels are very dependant on luck on the hardest "Grim" difficulty: If you don't get a good set of perks and weapons spawn then the levels with the "Russian Doll" spiders are impossible. 

Nevertheless it's still one of the best twin-stick shooters out there, just as it was in the early years of the century.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167704316', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1567502760}
review:
[b] 名称：血腥大地 重制版 [/b]

[h1] 不计其数的敌人们已经被老子一个人包围辣！ [/h1]

如果是在90-00年代国内盗版横行的游戏环境中成长起来的玩家，几乎都不可避免地接触过这样一个以搬运国外小游戏而闻名的合集作品-《幻想游戏系列》。

而《血腥大地》就是此系列中几个经典的扛把子代表作之一，一款经典的俯视角射击…如今这个年代应该叫“类吸血鬼幸存者游戏”了…
不过论资排辈，这个才是祖宗级的，游戏正式发售于2003年，该Steam版本为重制版，不但加强了画面、添加了新武器新天赋新任务，还支持了官方中文。

这游戏就主打一个爽。
以俯视角在山呼海啸般的敌人围杀努力存活，通过不断战斗升级武器天赋，最终杀出重围…

尽管乍看上去有点Kuso，但这玩意能在一代人童年占据一席之地还真不是浪得虚名，一上手就会发现《血腥大地》各种武器的射击手感出奇的优秀，打击感竟然不逊于第一人称！
游戏画面非常粗糙，但“糙”反而成为其爽快的根源，每干掉一个丑陋的怪物都会血浆四溅，伴着重金属摇滚和子弹时间尽显暴力美学，尤其爆炸清屏特别解压，臭豆腐般的浓烈芬芳扑面而来…

当然以现在的眼光，游戏的体量实在太小，普通难度不到十小时通关，当你多年来遍览各种3A大作后，偶然间再把本作翻出来体验，《血腥大地》给予玩家的爽快显然已经不是来源于画面技术或游戏设计，而是源自于那逝去的美妙童年。

review:
Are you a Fan Weapons? 
Do You like killing sh-it?
Do you hate spiders?
Dawg, I heard you liked Power ups n level ups
Think you will like Perks too

This is the Original game tat inspired Vampire, Nomad Survivors, except that you are being "Helpful" by shooting stuffs, collecting powerups, and selecting the perk that can save your life for a Highscore !

Yet I still want to include the pros:
1) Tons of Weapon
2) Tons of Mission
3) Tons of Perk
4) Tons of Powerup
5) Aside from quest, you got "Endless survivor " mode to play from after unlocking all the perks n weapons
6) So there's once upon a time, there's a crazy achievement that a lot of ppl can't obtain because you had to do n get the score in GemBine (2048 alike mini game) But now? they removed it because they listened to US in the Discord ! Like... NO WAY, it can be happens after the game development is DEAD.. Thank you so much Devs!


Problems?
1) This game had a fk ton of gambling, n luck based mechanics... (it's like, sometimes you get OP perks, OP weapons, but then sometimes? You Failed again n again)

10/10 Get it before you Buy Those idle Survival games

author: {'steamid': '76561197980112953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1656152208}
review:
I played Crimsonland a ton back when it first came out and had a lot of fond memories of it.

However, I was young and easily entertained back in 2003. Terrible design decisions, erratic balancing, and repetitive gameplay were easily paved over with the satisfying click of gauss weapons and the screen getting painted red. Nowadays, though, games have just generally gotten better to the point where Crimsonland's archaic design doesn't hold up.

First and foremost, the game is centered around random pickups. The weapon itself (with few exceptions) is fairly secondary outside of its relationship to the Fire Bullets pickup. This also spills into the Perk pool, where most perks are fairly pointless and every quest becomes trivial when you get Telekinesis. Because of the focus on pickups, there is little opportunity to have a "build" and gameplay quickly becomes repetitive.

The quests (campaign mode) are absurdly easy other than a few on Grim difficulty, where if you're unlucky on your initial weapon, initial perk, and a few pickups, you basically just lose. Otherwise, the main way to take damage comes down to enemies spawning on top of you.

I suppose if you want a mindless twin-stick shooter to play on the side, this game might be satisfying for a bit. Unfortunately, after playing games for all these years, I just find it boring now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974928204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 23115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 377, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1712278538}
review:
**EDIT 07/29/22**

Plays perfectly on my Steam Deck, both in hand held mode and in docked mode using an Xbox One Elite Series 2 controller connected via Bluetooth. In case anyone is interested in that information, since it is currently listed as Unknown.

One of my favorite Twin-Stick Shooters. I have literally purchased this game on every system it is available on, except mobile as I don't play any mobile games, and I have beaten the Quests in all three difficulty levels, Normal, Hardcore, and Grim. I have even gotten gold stars (Not a Scratch) in every single level on all three difficulty levels. and I have repeated this on every system I have this game on, which right now sits at 6, I believe. To say that I am obsessed with this game could be considered accurate, to say that I recommend this game would be an understatement. While my play time indicates 34 hours, I assure you I have hundreds more across multiple systems.

Buy this game, full price, on sale, it doesn't matter, just buy it and regardless of the price it will be money well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142561303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1257, 'last_played': 1709502241}
review:
This is a great top-down shooter.  It stays faithful to the Arcade format while adding a bit of a "Campaign Mode" with "quests" adding to replay value.  Multiplayer is supported.  I remember playing an early freeware demo of this game back in the early 2000s.

Highs:
Nice graphics
Fun gameplay
Cool selection of weapons
Great enemy design
Awesome soundtrack

Lows:
Perhaps a little too basic
Underrated

Bottom line:
Buy this game.  It's an unsung classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198817878797', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1651855289}
review:
作为一款经典爽快的双摇杆射击rogue类游戏，我们当前玩到的已经是重置过的版本了（通过steam平台启动，可自由选择原版或是重置版），重置版自带中文，这个相当友好！对于这款游戏，我的评价就是“麻雀虽小，五脏俱全”、“经典永不过时”。作为2014年的游戏，它拥有了大多数肉鸽游戏的基础设定，随机性主要表现在道具及武器的出现（每关的第一只怪一定会爆一把随机武器），还有技能的多样化选择。

游戏难度中等，想要挑战高分排名，唯手熟尔！某些挑战，运气方面是关键，本地同屏联机也不失为一个好办法。
至于每一关想要打出无伤获得星星，设定上是有取巧成分的——系统判定只要过关时是满血状态，就能够获得无伤评价（玩过的朋友应该都懂我意思，知道如何达成）。

随着通过游戏中一个个关卡，你会逐步解锁各种武器和技能，这里重点说一下最后两把武器以及最后一个技能的解锁方法——
最后两把武器：只需要通关最后两个难度便会依次解锁。
最后一个技能：找到菜单里的“制作人员”选项，点进去后，拉到最下面会有一句话“这里隐藏着一些东西”，使用鼠标左键点击这句话会听见效果音，多点击几次之后，就会进入一个类似2048的小游戏。游玩这个游戏并且达到最低记录分（约五万三千多分），就能解锁最后一个技能。（说实话，没找到诀窍之前，我觉得这隐藏游戏比无伤关卡难多了！）

最后是性价比方面，史低价（9r）良好，经典老游戏也进过包，渠道购买就是骨折价。不管是刚入肉鸽坑的菜鸟，还是想为之前补票的老鸟，都是不错的选择！你TMD还在等什么呢？赶快购买入库吧！

author: {'steamid': '76561198063231113', 'num_games_owned': 1275, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1642250025}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998904230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1646444159}
review:
So, I enjoy top-down shooters. I've played lots of them. This one is pretty fun. I do recommend this game (although I'd wait until it goes on sale, I got it for about half price).
But I ALMOST didn't recommend this game for ONE reason. 
The sound effect your character makes when he dies. 
It doesn't sound like someone dying. It sounds like the most ridiculously, absurdly, hilariously, over-the-top exaggerated orgasm in the history of sexual reproduction.
It's so annoying, I had to play without sound. It's that bad. Otherwise, fun game. Without sound.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991291322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1648853709}
review:
This is a classic twin-stick style shooter from way back in the day. I was surprised when I saw it on Steam, but it was great because it was updated with a bunch of new content and gamemodes. 
It's quite challenging but very fun and addictive. Getting a good survival run is so satisfying, and trying different builds is a good way to mix it up after things start to get stale. 
All told, this game still holds up and I've been having a good time replaying it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080493208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1613844780}
review: Twin stick shooters are usually a great time for me. Dating back to Robotron 2084 in the arcades, I've long had an affinity for this breed of game when done well. Looking to scratch that itch, I picked up Crimsonland from my Steam backlog and gave it a twirl. First, I'll mention that it's an old game, originally released in 2003. So it isn't a modern-day looker, but I nevertheless found the visuals clean and impressive in their limited scope. There are a variety of ways to play from a quest mode with 70 levels along with three difficulties to a variety of survival modes and a Typing of the Dead kind of mode called Typ'o'Shooter. The main quest mode was fun and engaging. I finished the game on the first two difficulties, but 'grim' proved to be, well, grim. Hardcore - the middle difficulty - was a nice challenge as the levels progressed, causing the nice type of stress where you're so engaged that everything else falls away and you find yourself in a state of flow - a hallmark of a good twin-stick for me. The most fun I had with the game was in one of the survival modes called 'Blitz' though. It's an accelerated version of the regular survival mode where things amp up more quickly. The basics of this mode, and the main quest mode, is that you gain experience while playing stages, and that levels you up allowing you to select from a variety of 'perks' to aid your man with a plan. These perks can range from being radioactive, which causes sustained damage to the baddies in close proximity, to perks that grant you faster re-load, better firepower with your current weapon, faster experience, more power-ups appearing, having those power-ups be magnetized to your player causing them to float towards you, among many others. So as you level up and progress, there is this nice sense of strategy about picking the right type of upgrade, knowing that you'll have only so many as you try to stay alive as long as possible. It's also a fun type of lottery in the randomization of offered perks. On some chances to pick a perk, you'll not find anything that you're particularly interested in on the current run, and on others, you might want them all. There's also a perk to allow more perks to appear at each level gained, giving you a better chance to find just the right one. There's also a huge selection of weapons that drop in the killing spree. Some are significantly better than others, but most are viable, and many appear differently, both visually and in their practical/strategical application. There are also the aforementioned power-ups that are dropped which can really lead to greater havoc. From nuclear bombs that clear out big hordes around you, to spinning waves of fire, slow motion, increased movement speed, freezing all enemies, health bonuses and on and on, there are many beneficial drops that you want to desperately pick up - if you can get to them. When you're in a zone and you've got the right set of perks and power-ups dropping with hordes surrounding from all sides, the screen really comes alive in a beautiful dance of frenetic chaos that keeps you poised on the edge of your seat. Overall, I really had a good time with this in the 17 or so hours I played with it. It's not the cream of the crop in the genre, but it's great fun and I'm very happy I gave it some of my time. I can see myself returning for another set of runs on Blitz mode from time to time just to see if I can climb higher on the leader boards or just for the sheer enjoyment of the action. Recommended. 4/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028307648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1703872786}
review:
Used to play this game when I was young and it still is fun. If you love survival games like cod zombies you will love this. 

The survival mode from the original version is much better (good that it is included as welll). The new survival mode feels shorter since you get overwhelmed very easily and don't get a sense of having a chance in the end. I also miss evil eyes and pyromaniac in the new one.  Simply put the newer version of survival feels like cod onslaught vs older round based zombies in COD zombies although I did like onslaught for some reason but not here :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032010500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1646591917}
review:
I think if you're looking at a very dated classic like this, it's probably because you're interested in playing a very dated classic like this. It doesn't last very long, and it doesn't give me that addictive "one more go" feeling that a lot of this genre does, but it's solid enough. Maybe not at full price though - I got it at 50% (£5.29) and I'm not convinced I'll get my moneys worth.

All that aside, if you suffer from arachnophobia, probably give it a miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048092359', 'num_games_owned': 1702, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1645645580}
review:
This game feels very outdated in terms of gameplay and general design that i can't recommend it.

The gunplay doesn't feel good, weapons have no knockback, it doesn't make a difference if you use a minigun or a shotgun or a machine gun they all feel similiar and only really differ in powerlevel. The quest mode is fine if you play it once but hardcore and grim are just the same levels again with a couple more enemies and they might also have more hp but for 90% of the levels they are effectively the same levels and it feels like a chore because they are so repetitive. Speaking about chores a lot of the achievements are just wasting your time, the packrat makes you collect 50 of the worst weapon which will take over an hour even if you use an extra controller to speed up the process. Gembine is just not fun and some of the other score achievements are also luckbased.

Played the original A LOT when it came out back in 2003 (19 years ago!).
The re-release is even better, more polished and has fantastic gameplay.

Easy to learn, hard to master.

review:
The legendary top-down (twin-stick) shooter.

Not very flashy by some standards but addictive.

Steam 2014 version is somewhat different from the original. I think it's for good.
But the original version is also included (it says "2003 version" but, judging from logs, it is 1.9.93 - the latest original version).

author: {'steamid': '76561197971013411', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1648924163}
review:
Crimsonland es un juego que recuerdo con mucho cariño y entusiasmo, hace mucho tiempo era de los juegos que "aprovechaban" los avances técnicos más modernos de las tarjetas 3D y lograba efectos que en aquel entonces eran bastante impresionantes. Sin embargo por lo que más recuerdo esta belleza de juego es por lo atascado, es un verdadero deleite "pintar" ese suelo de rojo (de allí el nombre del juego).

Lo jugue hace muchísimo tiempo, y ahora que lo vuelvo a tomar me sorprende mucho... es como el de antes, pero mejorado y actualizado. No solo le agregaron logros, tarjetas de steam e integración para jugar con remoteplay, sino que también le han agregado varias mecánicas con los años, todo ello vuelven a hacer que valga la pena.

No recuerdo cuanto pagué por él, pero no es un juego caro, y si es un juego que vale cada centavo que costó. Se puede jugar con varios amigos al mismo tiempo y eso lo hace todavía más entretenido. No es un juego revolucionario, ni siquiera es un juego original, pero les aseguro que si le dan una oportunidad los mantendrá bastante entretenidos por unas buenas horas. Actualmente me encuentro enfrascado en un duelo con varios amigos de la época, queremos sacarle todo y ver quién logra los mejores marcadores ¡para esto son estos jueguitos, para sacarles todo el jugo posible!

No es un juego complicado (aunque si necesitarán un control con dos palancas si quieren ser pro) ni un juego con una basta historia, creo que la belleza de este juego radica en su sencillez y en que es muy directo: vas a machacar zombies, aliens y plagas en un festín de sangre que hará que te regocijes, en el camino probarás diversas armas y poderes que te ayudaran (o aumentarán el reto).

¡Super recomendable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198149156641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1651332136}
review: Senaryoymuş hikayeymiş bunlar yok. Tam arada açıp yaratık vurayım kafasında oynanabilecek, silah çeşitliliğinin gayet yeterli olduğu, survival modu (dört kişiye kadar oynanabilir) eğlendiren, baştan sona bir 2d arena shooter. Mobil versiyonu da sağlamdır. Oldschool'a selam ola...

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146805', 'num_games_owned': 4104, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2209, 'last_played': 1464026704}
review: Great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198333003738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12164, 'last_played': 1652500357}
review: Hands down my favorite game ever. I've purchased it on 6+ platforms at this point. Crimsonland doesn't do many things but what it does do is flawless yet very simple and perfect to pick up and put down over the span of 5 minutes or several hours. The survival, blitz, and waves are where the game shines most. Pick this game up if you chase leaderboards or like very simplified games. It does get repetitive after you complete the quest but its worth it when you know you may place higher on the leaderboards on the next try. There aren't many people asking for a direct sequel but I like to dream. This is a remaster/remake from 2003 (which is included with the purchase) I highly recommend this gem to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082953615', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7530, 'last_played': 1644297132}
review:
Игра крутая, затягивающая и заставляющая бомбить переодически ) Хотелось бы, чтобы было меньше бесполезного оружия для Выживания. Ну то есть баланс всего в целом выравнять. Хотя это уже не раз делали конечно, но в итоге не пришли мне кажется к норме. Условно там плазменный дробовик или рассекатель нерфили и тп.

Бесит телекинез. Сделали бы ПКМ - уничтожить спелл, ячейку. Из-за этого очень неприятно играть с Mini-Rocket Swarmers, потому что подбор огненных пуль подобен смерти. Ну да, можно подобрать сразу плазменные пули, но они не всегда есть:)

вообще огенные пули слабоватыми стали. Были бы они не только количественно разные, но и в зависимости от пушки чтобы сила огенной пули была разная. Условно, чтобы огненные гаусовы пули были сильнее обрезовских. Чтобы с ион-пушками (3 снарядовой и самой громадной) был смысл тоже брать огненный снаряды... Да и те же мини-рокеты - почему только 1 снаряд огненной пули, а не столько, сколько рокет?

а еще не хватает песочницы какой-нибудь, чтобы потестить "билды", проверять сочетаемость перков-пушек и тп.

короче много рассуждать можно )))

author: {'steamid': '76561198037308339', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 21686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4343, 'last_played': 1707016656}
review:
Вы когда нибудь слышали о стране крови? Где вы подобный Палачу Рогу человек, ведет войну за человечество против любой твари, которая хочет уничтожить человечество. Вы обычный человек убивающий целую орду пришельцев, гигантских пауков, мутантов, зомби и другой нежити, жаждущая уничтожить человечество.
Шутер с видом сверху.
Плюсы игры:
1) Хороший выбор оружия;
2) Классное музыкальное сопровождение, побуждающее на максимальное выживание;
3) Очень простой геймплей, который поймет любой человек.
Минус только один - нет возможности играть в коопе, без контролеров.
Данная игра является ремейком оригинальной страны крови. 
И этот ремейк заслуженно получает 10/10 балл и мою рекомендацию к покупке!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011250864', 'num_games_owned': 1891, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1633362992}
review:
Top down horde shooter with RNG. TLDR bellow.

Right off the bat, if you bought this and just started, go into the menu and activate perks and 1.5 game speed. In my opinion that should be the default, but hope you find it in time before the game grinds you out.

So theres no story here, visuals and sound are quite simple.
Gameplay is a horde survival mode. Enemies spawn and you need to kill them to progress to the next level. Or you can play endless survival mode. 
Most levels you start out with a pistol, which becomes increasingly useless the further you progress. Enemies will drop a random weapon in the beginning and keep dropping random weapons the more you play. The more levels you complete, the more different weapons and perks you unlock that can be dropped. Map is always the same rectangle without any obstacles or modifications.
Im not sure if this is an issue or its by design, but a lot of later weapons are just improved older weapons. Like plasma machine gun instead of AK. The higher you go up, the less viable older weapons become, purely because they dont have the punching power. So its quite possible you can lose a round because you had a bad drop and it couldnt carry you long enough to get a better one. You also cant lock a weapon choice. Meaning if you accidentally ran over a weapon you didnt want, you will still pick it up.
Now the hordes. A lot of them are just variations of a default grunt. They change a skin for them when entering a new zone. There are unique ones as well. Invisible, fast and deadly, shooting, tanky, exploding. But the round variety usually is the default one with a unique one. It feels that way for me at least.
You need to kite them in a smart way, because they drop stuff when you kill them, so you need to be in a position to pick them up. They drop either weapons or power ups like health, nuke, freeze, other stuff. Problem is it can become so many you dont really have anywhere to kite to, unless the power ups clear some of them out.
You also dont see how enemies attack when they get close, leaving guess work if you will be hit or you can dodge.
Almost every level is a variation of you being swarmed. Sometimes it starts directly with units, others it puts pawn points you need to destroy.
The perks give you a random bonus once you kill a certain amount of enemies, it adds some variety. But the game doesnt show which perks you have active. Remember - turn the perks on in the options menu.
The gun spread can be quite annoying as well. Enemies are pretty small on the screen so aiming can be a hassle.
Weapons dont feel like they have a punch.

Apparently, this game (or a version of it) was originally created in around 2004. That makes a lot of sense. The simplistic graphics and gameplay, the disproportionately high review score. For a game from 2004, likely a free browser one, yes! I can see why people liked it back then. But for a game for 2014 and especially 2021 its very outdated in a lot of categories. Maybe while listening to something in the background to keep yourself busy, but not as a main experience.

TLDR - outdated, repetitive, tedious.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198388973421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1629845663}
review:
Very tedious and repetitive, very poorly balanced, tons of visual clutter makes it hard to determine where enemies are, enemies spawn on top of you with no indication, no environmental variety whatsoever (literally every stage is a colored rectangle with invisible walls), default movement speed is agonizingly slow and you have no dash or other mobility, lacks QoL improvements like being able to see your current perks or lock your current weapon, and is very RNG dependent and frustrating because of this. 

The fact that you frequently start with a worthless peashooter and have to find a decent gun through hordes of bullet sponge enemies is just really annoying. So many weapons are pointless while others are just extremely powerful. So many perks are pointless, while others are extremely powerful. Sure, a lot of games utilize RNG with powerups and drops, but in this game specifically if you get bad RNG then you basically just die, because it's like trying to put out a forest fire with a squirt gun. 

Every single level pretty much goes one of two ways:
-You get a decent weapon and/or perk, mow down all the enemies, get showered with powerups and can basically beat the level with your eyes closed.
-You get a worthless weapon and/or perk, you die to the massive hordes of bullet sponge enemies because you have zero damage or mobility whatsoever, and you can't spawn powerups because of the aforementioned zero damage. 

Just get Tesla vs. Lovecraft. It's essentially the exact same game from the same dev team, just a bit better and has QoL improvements like being able to lock your weapon and being able to see your current perks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966692029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1951, 'last_played': 1629089503}
review:
Having been around for a long time, Crimsonland isn't evoking excitement in the gaming community any more.  Still, it's a surprisingly entertaining game, and for the little amount of money it costs these days, is definitely worth considering when deciding where to spend your cheddar...

It's a rogue-lite top-down twin-stick shooter with multiple modes of play, in which levels are beaten by killing everything in them with the various weapons & powerups you find there.  There's very little level "design", per se; each is a floor composed of different kinds/combinations of mobs, sometimes with respawn nests and sometimes without.  You never have the ability to see what's happening on the entire map, so discovery is limited to what your screen shows at the time.

This may sound boring, but it's more nerve-wracking than anything else.  The different mobs have varying abilities, but en masse, they're all dangerous.  Some move faster than others, some shoot or poison you, some split into multiple smaller mobs when shot, etc.  In most levels, they swarm at you from some part of the floor that you can't see, and thus don't know if there's a spawn point that needs to be killed or not.  Your own movement is frustratingly slow, and so you quickly discover that you need to do more than simply kiting mobs around the map (although that certainly is a large part of the gameplay.

You'll also discover that being able to hit things from a long ways off is both key and difficult.  You have an aiming reticle that shrinks when you're stationary as well as not firing; movement and gunfire decrease your weapon's accuracy, as indicated by an expanding reticle.  Let me be clear: you're almost always moving, so accuracy is something you have to manage.  So is ammunition, which never runs out, but forces you to have to reload at often very inconvenient times...

Luckily, the number of weapons and power-ups is significant.  Killing stuff also grants XP, and during the level, gameplay stops each time your level increases, allowing you to choose one of the perks the RNG offers you.  The combination of perks guns and powerups (which never last long enough) allows you to create effective builds, albeit limited by the way the components are randomly available to you.

The campaign consists of beating several tiers of levels at a specific difficulty.  Once you hit the highest difficulty (aka. Grim), the game becomes almost merciless, forcing you to rely upon focused builds.  Still, there are challenges (in-game achievements) to keep you busy as well - all of which lead to weapon/power-up unlocks.

For the money, it's a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069635016', 'num_games_owned': 2885, 'num_reviews': 808, 'playtime_forever': 2394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2394, 'last_played': 1626293747}
review:
[h1] Как положишь вон тот рой, ты потом тут пол отмой... [/h1]

[b]Crimsonland[/b] на пару - переиздание классического мясного-соусного инди-выживача.

Игровой процесс заключается в уничтожении или несчетных попытках уничтожения [strike]синюшным[/strike] синим [strike]думгаем[/strike] космодесантником всяких жуков-пауков, зомбей и креветок. Данное действие приправляется случайно появляющимися бахалками и бонусами, а также приобретаемыми по ходу забега умениями.

+ Включает в себе оригинальную версию 2003 о.-р.г., а также выбор визуализации между DirectX 9 или 11 
+ 70 заготовленных сценариев битв и 7 режимов бесконечного выживания
+ Плюшки-пушки-рок'эн'ролл
+ Локальный кооператив на 4-х (необходимо закупиться 3-мя грибковыми геймпадами!)
+ Gembine

- Сюжет, который подается только названиями уровней
- Для двух открывающихся сложностей 68 сценариев довольно просты
- Одно пустое (в геометрическом плане) поле битвы, на котором меняется только текстура поверхности
- 4 сопроводительные музыкальные композиции - Вы серьёзно?
- D3D11 всего лишь как-то пестрее и рисованнее
- Вшита реклама собственных игр
- Долбежка в Gembine за ачивкой сильно изматывает

Легко втянуться, тяжело отвернуться, можно никогда не вернуться!
Для тех, кому тема "размазывания" близка по духу или роду деятельности.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015469574', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1709799366}
review:
Хорошая игра. Единственно, пройдя обновленную версию, прошла первоначальный вариант. 
По факту прохождения у меня появился только один вопрос: "а на кой черт вообще эта обновленная версия?
Отличия оригинала от новой чисто субъективные ощущения:
1. В новой перс еле ползает, что бесит, в старой по ощущениям бодрее.
2. В старой больше понравилась картинка.
3. В старой удобнее и информативнее интерфейс.
4. В старой при повышении уровня ты сам нажимаешь на повышение, когда удобно, в новой все прерывается часто в самый неудобный момент, в результате чего после повышения уровня меня убивают.

Короче игра хорошая, но зачем она сделана, когда первоначальный вариант гораздо лучше и бодрее играется - загадка...

После очередного убитого часа ,чтобы побить рекорд в этой сра--й игре 2048 желаю гореть в аду тому гению, который в качестве задротства в титрах к топ даун шутеру прикрепил не какой-нибудь новый режим убиения, а чертову логическую игрушку. Хотела бы игру "пятнащки" - купила бы пятнашки. Ну ок, прикрутил, так какого х... надо было ачивку привязывать к ней(

author: {'steamid': '76561198042622357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 2278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2143, 'last_played': 1690469791}
review:
Do not underestimate this one. What looks and smells like a standard top down Shooter must Not always taste like one. 

Even though its more of an arcade thing you will get challenged and motivated to stick to your guns and go for another run. 

Different playstyles and extras, as well as an arsenal of thought trough weaponry wait for you to combine them with the right perks, power ups and temp buffs to feel like the Doomslayer on the cover of the first Doom Installation. Not less.

This Game is a great success.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177866539', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1674480833}
review:
Çocukluğumun oyunu. Hala ayakta olduğunu, yapımcıların ilgilendiğini görmek güzel. Grafikler, efektler düzeltilmiş, daha güzel bir oyun deneyimi sunulmuş.

Oyun, oturup aralıksız 5-10 saat oynanacak türden bir oyun değil, ama arada açıp yarım saat 1 saat oynanabilir, gayet zevkli oluyor. Oyundaki mod ve zorluk çeşitliliği de hoşuma gitti, küçükken hiç farketmemişim.

İndirime düştüğünde alınabilir. Vakit geçirmek veya nostalji yapmak için ideal bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039217087', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1535217249}
review:
Слегка обидно что не учтены сотни часов, проведённых в ней ещё в дремучие нулевые, когда отец притащил её на жирной по тем временам 128-мегабайтной флешке, ну да ладно. Годы уже не те, чтобы тратить сотни часов в бессюжетной игрушке, пытаясь перебить рекорд какого-то Васи Пупкина с Джекхаммером, молясь на бонусы fireshot и перки к перезарядке обреза. Но даже сейчас это почти настолько же расслабляюще-медитативный процесс, как какие-нибудь bulet-hell'ы, за вычетом фрустрации, или казуалки а ля три-в-ряд, за вычетом полной деградациии.

Всё ещё есть возможность посостязаться с очередным Васей Пупкиным за строчку в лидербордах, всё ещё есть каждый классический режим, и изменения ничуть не портят оригинальную концепцию, подтягивая геймплей и графику к современным стандартам вариативности и вовлечения. А для пуристов всегда есть оригинальная версия. (:

10 плевучих пауков из 1 гаусс-шотгана

author: {'steamid': '76561198119147703', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1674789557}
review:
This was my first time playing a top-down shooter, because I just didn't really think the top-down angle was great. I just so happened to give Crimsonland a shot, and I'm very glad I did. 

Crimsonland is one of those games where you can play a couple levels at a time without much thought. To me, it is arcade-style, where the controls are simple and the levels can be quick yet challenging. There are a lot of fun components in the game, such as unlocking and using a variety of perks and weapons. The wide range of perks are cool, and really fun(ny) to read about. Did I also mention how satisfying it is to see the alien, zombie, and bug blood splatter the ground as you pillage through the levels?

author: {'steamid': '76561197985797360', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1629761199}
review:
Voy a darle "SÍ" porque no se deja poner nota. No voy a decir que no merezca la pena o que se malo, porque no lo es, pero es un juego repetitivo desde el primer disparo hasta el ultimo. La campaña con un total de 70 misiones (si mal no recuerdo) y con una duracion de dos horas; consiste en matar todo lo que se mueve en un mapa plano y sin nada de por medio, sólo bichos. 

Al terminar la campaña accederás a varios tipos de mapas en modo "supervivencia".

author: {'steamid': '76561197979307379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1492208095}
review:
Habe den Titel schon Anfang der 2000er gespielt, damals noch ohne Controller Unterstützung.
Immer auf der Jagd seinen eigenen Highscore zu schlagen und so viele Monster, Mutanten, Zombies und Insekten wie möglich zu töten.
Die überarbeitete Fassung im TwinStick Gewand, für bis zu 4 Spieler (Couch CoOp), bietet so einiges mehr...mehr Waffen..mehr Perks...mehr Spaß!!!

So hatte ich mir das schon damals gewünscht..gut das es umgesetzt wurde!!!

Der Wille so lange wie möglich am Leben zu bleiben versetzt dich immer wieder in einen suchtartigen Rausch, der nach jedem Dahinscheiden den Wunsch einer weiteren Dosis deinen Daumen das nächste Match auslösen lässt!

Für TwinStick Fetischisten ein unbedingtes Muss!!!

System: Amiga 500+ mit 1mb Speichererweiterung
