author: {'steamid': '76561197972684485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1663237061}
review:
NOTE: I have not played the original and am not comparing them accordingly.
The Good: Unique challenges, very stable, very responsive, many unique perks, many weapons, challenging but not to the point of being absurd, top down works well for it.
The Bad: By default perks aren't given to you in story mode as implied, weopons can be luck of the draw which sometimes shafts you.
Top down horde shooter that's made very well and provides a great experience

author: {'steamid': '76561198078802912', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1514548150}
review:
Crimsonland is a fairly simple concept of top-down shooting and tonnes of mayhem - imagine Serious Sam from a top-down perspective. The three things I can guarantee you with Crimsonland: hoards of mobs, lashings of blood and a colossal arsenal at your disposal. 

Overall it is an incredibly enjoyable experience that I have no hesitation in recommending to anyone looking for a challenge and trip down memory lane. It won’t appeal to everyone due to its difficulty level and outdated design, but the gameplay is satisfying overall. I personally couldn’t play too many lengthened sessions as it does become repetitive after some time, however the variety in weapons and mobs, not to mention the addition of the various survival modes helps to keep things fresh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119926007', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1475312181}
review:
На мой взгляд, переиздание не удалось. Я всецело присоединяюсь к воплям по поводу перка "телекинез" и отсутствия возможности выбора перков в квестах. Зачем было менять эти две вещи которые так сильно влияли на геймплей - я не понимаю. От себя добавлю, что отсутсвует синхронизации сохранений, для меня это большой минус.

Старый "Crimsonland" я бы оценил на 8  из 10. Новый я так оценить не смогу. Тянет он максимум на 6 баллов. 

Но все же, мясо здесь вкусное, по этому, отзыв, в целом, положительный.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002518269', 'num_games_owned': 2043, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1420244049}
review: A solid top-down single screen twin-stick shooter.  Enemies spawn, you shoot them.  Sometimes they drop power ups or new weapons to let you kill them faster.  6 worlds each with 10 levels.  You unlock new weapons as you go, and the enemy types are interesting enough that it stays fun for those 60 levels.  You also unlock perks but you only use them in survival mode, which I didn't really get in to.  Took me a little over 3 hrs to beat the 60 levels and I had fun with it.

review:
Fun and simple, easy to get into and hard to master.  Great sound and atmosphere.  The hallmarks of a great game.

Although having only local co-op was a huge let down, it gave me an excuse to actually have my buddy come over and play it, so its really not that bad.  Plays well on both mouse/keyboard and controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964410359', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1702764054}
review:
Ahhh, Crimsonland, c'est plus tout jeune. Remake d'un shareware bien connu des débuts d'internet, crimsonland est un top-down shooter centré sur le bourrinage. Pas de scénario, de dialogue ou autre fioritures, des flingues et des méchants qui remplissent l'écran pour venir vous faire la nique, et des power-ups qui font tout péter. Si la recette était défoulante à l'époque, les codes de gameplay ont depuis un peu évolué, mais le jeu, à travers son portage, n'a pas changé. 
Pis, il a même légèrement régressé, avec quelques fonctionalités manquantes et quelques équilibrages assez discutables ajoutés sur les armes et talents disponibles. Le contenu n'est pas énorme, Crimsonland ça a toujours été un jeu d'arcade avec une carte unique qui se joue au score total. Graphiquement c'est de la 2D très basique, pas vraiment différent de l'original, l'amélioration ne saute pas vraiment aux yeux si ce n'est la modernisation (excessive?) des interfaces. 
Un remake potable d'un jeu qui n'a pas très très bien vieilli donc, plutôt à réserver aux nostalgiques, le marché des top-down shooters s'étant enrichi de titres bien plus captivants depuis l'époque de gloire du titre original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017660592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1629788824}
review: I don't remember too much of the original Crimsonland so I can't comment on how much better or worse it is - but overall it's still a really fun game. Controls with mouse/keyboard are spot on, and survival mode is crazy addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966751192', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1491336585}
review:
Excellent little hardcore top-down shooter, a revamped version of the freeware PC version from the early 2000's. The gameplay never changes, but the campaign missions offer enough variety in objectives and surprises to keep you interested for the entire game. Unlock weapons and perks for the survival mode (or, if you're sneaky, pause the game during campaign mode and type "grim" to unlock perks for campaign mode too!).

Oh, it's also got four player co-op, but it's local only. You'll be needing controllers for that, which I guess would work nicely with Big Picture mode and a Steambox.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157906427', 'num_games_owned': 2619, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1533478000}
review:
Arena style shmup with gauntlet sytle spawners, more guns than i've ever seen in a single game, nearly as many different enemies and 5 times that of sub types and bosses. 

Its a simple idea very well executed, difficulty progression is balanced, although the random nature of drops can at times make easier levels hard and rarely a harder level easier.

Loads to do with many modes, and given the random nature of things even replaying a previous level for a better result never feels the same.

Graphics are ok, could have been better but for accessability to lower systems they are just fine and the music could not have been better compliments the game very well and is high quality.

Time can fly by playing this game and is made 10 times better if you have some joypads and some friends to play with with upto 4 ppl local.

Is it worth the £10.59 asking price, for me it is not. I recived as part of a £6 bundle including 7 games and at that price was a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994502282', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1917, 'last_played': 1695077729}
review:
So, I beat the re-release of Crimsonland last night. It was fun and it was nice seeing the game updated for HD but it's no where near as good as the original. A lot of things were taken out of the game for some reason, the survival mode is way slower paced and perks aren't enabled in quest mode anymore but those are just a few examples of the many changes 10Tons made. Would I still recommend it? Yeah, the game is just as fun as it always was and the complaints I have are more like nitpicks from someone who remembers the original game. If you like top down shooters and want a game to sink a few hours into when you've got nothing better to do then be sure to give Crimsonland a go, you shouldn't be disappointed. Oh and keep this in mind, quest mode is just the tip of the iceberg with Crimsonland. The real meat of the game comes with the survival modes but just don't go diving head first into survival, you'll want those perk and weapon unlocks from quest mode.

Edit: With recent updates there has been a little bit of a rebalance with the weapons and perks, this makes the game a little easier to start in survival mode but doesn't overdo it. The devs actually listen to feedback as well and try to implement good ideas from those who enjoy the game. Overall still highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076530230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1443901445}
review:
Top down shooters legend, reworked in HD with some extra weapons. Was a masterpiece decade ago,when first time gave it a shot,it still remains such.

If you're looking for exciting game to play on office PC or low-end laptop and dont mind entire screen becoming red from rivers of blood you're going to spill, Crimsonland is one of the best choices steam currently offers you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031512454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2152, 'last_played': 1683532728}
review:
Теперь можно рекомендовать эту обновленную версию, т.к. сейчас все встало на сво мместа: режим Quest можно проходить и проходить на разных уровнях сложности. 
Я все -таки прошел Quest на всех доступных и на каждом получил звезду за "Not a scratch" (ни царапины) - это когда ты завершаешь раунд с полным запасом здоровья. Конечно пришлось постараться и потратить ни один вечер на это (подсказка: перк регенерации). 

Что изменилось по сравнению с предыдущими версиями: оружие стало сбалансировано в том плане что при умелом обращении и правильном выборе перков почти каждое помогает затащить раунд (а не как раньше только конкретные пушки)

Да, чтобы получить достижения придется ни раз провести долгие часы на каком-то уровне, но в целом игра гораздо больше понравилась чем олдскульные версии, которые были до выхода на стим
256 делящихся пауков из 1

author: {'steamid': '76561198041786271', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1418241793}
review: Nie grałem w klasyczną wersje, więc nie wiem co zmienia ta odświeżona wersja na steam oprócz grafiki. Jest to shooter widziany z lotu ptaka, który na pierwsze oko wydaje się łatwy ale to tylko złudzenie. Ograniczona kwadratowa mapa, gdzie z każdej strony nacierają hordy kosmitów. Nie jest to tylko głupie strzelanie, zdarzają się etapy gdzie trzeba użyć odpowiedniej taktyki i przemyśleć przyszłe ruchy. Wiele broni, umiejętności pasywnych, rzeczy do zbierania i dużo krwi i wnętrzności.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071705317', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 23625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 28, 'playtime_at_review': 15109, 'last_played': 1712069812}
review:
The cult classic is back. This time with updated graphics, weapons, perks, and game modes.

I was a huge fan of the original and was ecstatic to see it get rereleased on Linux.

When it comes to top down shooters, Crimsonland is by far the best out there. Controls are very percise and mappable. The graphics update is beautiful when compared to the original and quite nice for being a 2D game. The interface also got a face lift. Orignially, your ammo count was an image on the top that showed you how many shots you had left. Now, it is a counter above the mouse. I prefer this seeing as I'm mostly looking at the mouse. In the original, any bonus you picked up would give you a count down in the upper left. Now, if the bonus affects your gun (firing rate, fire bullets, etc.) you get a yellow countdown around your mouse. If the bonus affects your character (shield) you get a clock like counter around your health bar (which is also now around the character instead of in the upper left hand corner). There are no countdowns for 2x, Freeze, or Speed bonuses. Some indication would be helpful, especially for the Speed bonus. But, I won't fault them too much on those. Lastly, the perk selector was overhauled as well. Originally, a window would pop up that listed the perks in a vertical list with a discription on the bottom. Now, they are images listed horizontally with the name under it when the mouse is hovered over it and the discription on the bottom and the biggest difference is that in the original you would hit Tab to open the perk selector. In the new version it appears automatically and you are forced to pick something to continue.

Some of the weapons updates are nice but I feel that there are too many. While they are nice, since the weapon drops are completely at random you might never get the gun you really need for late game. Also, before the 1.9 patch of the original there was a trick to using the Pulse Gun and using the Angry Reloader perk that just made you dominate the map early on. This was "fixed" in 1.9 which was a huge let down in my opinion.

I can't really say much about the perk other than telekenisis. This perk was changed heavily. Originally, you would hover your mouse over a bonus for a full second and you would pick it up. This made you have to be looking in its direction, which made it hard if you had enemies behind you. You basically had to stop shooting at them to pick up the bonus or time it so you could position them between you and the bonus to shot them. Now, the closest bonus will move towards you. I actually prefer this new method over the previous. Lets you focus more on the fight and less about trying to pick up the bonus. My only complaint is that I think the longer the bonus is traveling, the faster it should move. If you are running backwards, the bonus will never reach you because you can out run it. Still a better approach, though.

They also added a new game mode. Nukefism gives you no weapons and only bonuses to pick up. Very hard game mode which is why the achievement is unlocked when you get 75,000 points in it. 

With all of this being said, I feel that the price may be a little bit high considering that the original was only 10 dollars USD in 2004. By no means do I consider this a 14 dollar title, especially when they removed a great game mode and didn't really add anything of a story. When Survival mode will last, at best, 10 minutes before you get overwhelmed by enemies, these quick matches, I feel, makes the 14 dollar USD price tag a little bit much. However, on sale, this is a great buy.

The biggest drawback to Crimsonland is that it relies a bit too rmuch on the random factor. I would have loved to see a game mode like Survival but where you can remove, say, 10 weapons and 15 perks from the pool. This would let someone get rid of some of the bad weapons and perks (like the Blowtorch... seriously, the Blowtorch? Why? I'd rather take the Pulse gun over the Blowtorch).

Lastly, the Linux port was amazingly done. Performance was as expected. Some reports of reversed X axis on game pads which I believe are fixed as of this writing (or will be fixed soon). I did experience 1 random crash but I think that was caused by something else happening at the same time.

If you are a fan of quick match top down shooters, storyless and senseless violence, or simple time killer games, I highly recommend this game. If you were a fan of the original, you might be left with a bad taste, but I was not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040264346', 'num_games_owned': 1085, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1419814383}
review:
Crimsonland 曾经这是我最喜欢的休闲游戏之一，当听说它要登录 Steam 时，我毫不犹豫的投出了“是”的一票。
但是当我看到14美元的定价时，我犹豫了一下。
最近它入了 indiegala ，我觉着是时候尝试一下了。

尽管它有着重绘过的画面，并且我感觉还不错，更多的关卡，排行榜以及成就同时改善了之前游戏中一些不合理的地方。
但是
重做的 UI 完全没有初版的感觉
完全去除了任务中的Peak，改为了任务中解锁，生存模式中使用，同时任务的每一关的长度降低了不少，20分钟玩通一大关（我知道可以在隐藏菜单里调出Peak，但是如此隐蔽的方式意味着开发者根本没打算把他开放）
Peak其他方面的修改也大多不怎么合适，比如 Telekinisis 简直是在逗我，原来的鼠标悬停使用哪里不好了？为啥要变成磁铁？还会自动换武器，简直坑爹啊
有了多人合作，但是只有本地合作……你一定是在逗我

总体上来说，生存模式变得比之前稍稍有趣了一些，但是，任务模式的可玩性大大降低，并不是所有人都把生存模式当作主要模式的，比如我。

作为一个曾经的 Crimsonland 玩家，我十分喜欢原版，但是，抱歉，我实在无法推荐重制版，这不是 Crimsonland，我宁可继续玩原版，而不是这个进步不足退步有余的重制版。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968671893', 'num_games_owned': 9219, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 5217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5217, 'last_played': 1419162527}
review:
I loved this game when it first came out, and I'm loving the re-release as well!

Basically a classic 2D, top down shooter with multiple game modes.

For quest, there is varying arenas of difficulty, with different challenges and enemy combinations to overcome. There's not really a story to quest mode other than "Shoot 'em all!", which is good enough for me!

There are also several different kinds of survival modes, including seeing how long you can last without a gun.

Fallout may have popularized Perks in games, but Crimsonland was the first to bring it to shooters, which is probably one of the things that makes it such a great game. The massive amount of guns combined with numerious perk combos ensures you never get the same game twice.

And if you like secrets, there are several of those scattered around as well. ;)

Considering the game was originally released in 2003, it has aged pretty well.

If you like 2D shooters, grab this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052731540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1419615001}
review:
Es uno de esos juegos que no te entran por los ojos y que al empezar a jugarlos piensas que no te van a gustar. Es más, quieres odiarlo. Sus graficos son malos, no existe historia y practicamente carece de originalidad. 

Lamentablemente para mi alma "hater" tengo que reconocer que me gusta este juego. Es MUY ADICTIVO y altamente entretenido. Sin darme cuenta pase una tarde jugando a la ultima pantalla hasta que me la pase y desbloquee todos los modos de juego y el modo de dificultad extra.

Un juego con el que pasar unos ratos muertos o una tarde lluviosa. 

No será la estrella de tu biblioteca pero le puedes sacar unas horas de diversion. Recomendable por un buen precio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019712086', 'num_games_owned': 2221, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1418466211}
review:
没有玩过原作，不过感觉玩起来像双摇杆的手机游戏。
游戏难度适中，突突突的爽快感还是非常不错的。
解锁的天赋和武器众多，也算是一个优点。
缺点有2个，第一是人物移动太慢，感觉后面一些关卡手残党（例如我）比较难无伤过关。。
另外就是掉卡时间。。我现在玩了5个小时，还有2张卡没掉，WTF -.-
进包的货，还是可以入一个玩玩的。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998116681', 'num_games_owned': 3146, 'num_reviews': 600, 'playtime_forever': 2543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1682707460}
review:
They tried to fix something, which was not broken, and in result we have the worst version of crimsonland out there. But it is still one, and we don't have enough of games in this genre.

So, since then i pestered the devs a lot, and it seems i wasn’t alone, because they’ve fixed a lot of terrible decisions. Also they threw in some version similar to 1.98 for free. They’ve struggled with balance over the years a lot, at times making main survival as limited and repetitive as 1.40, but with no according narrative or coolness. But at this moment (1.3.1) i’d say the game is in acceptable state. survival is still soft-capped at puny 10 levels and you can't do a proper build or have a meaningfull session ~2020

author: {'steamid': '76561198004911379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1677806112}
review:
Es la versión moderna y mejorada de uno de mis juegos favoritos. Top down arcarde, hordas de bichos, mogollón de armas, items y habilidades. ¡Aprovechad la oferta de indiegala.com mientras esté disponible! Tiene multijugador local (hasta 4 por lo que parece Oo), aunque sigo echando de menos un multiplayer online. He jugado una hora y parece que han conseguido mejorar la versión anterior.

Ah, y teclado + ratón mejor que pad. 

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970644409', 'num_games_owned': 6457, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1411937398}
review:
[b]Crimsonland[/b]
Rating: 6/10

This game is about destroying aliens, critters and other vermin. You move around the map, which is basically your screen, and have to shoot lots and lots of enemies while picking up perks, weapons, ammo, upgrades and dodging your enemies and bullets. 

Graphics and sound is ok, controls are ok and tuned well to this kind of gameplay. Levels and missions are a bit dull.

The game strongly reminds me of Red Nation, which has zombies instead of these guys and is imo slightly better tuned and balanced. 

In the end the game is fun to play and keeps you busy for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972918264', 'num_games_owned': 11679, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1419141839}
review: I bought this on GOG.com and then got a steam install as well.  It's a twin stick shooter which plays well on the xbox 360.  The game is quite simple but challenging and fun.  Something like robotron (one of my favorite arcade games of all time) but with leveling and different types of guns.  I have played single player and multiplayer local on the computer with my ten year old son.  I recommend it and if you want to get it at a fantastic price (Dec 8, 2014) - check out the indiegala monday bundle.  Also i have emailed the dev/studio and they were helpful, friendly and generous so you are supporting good people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048587276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1406909109}
review:
I did play the original and I really like the fact that the game has been moved to HD format. I played a hell out of it and I think it is safe to say that story only begins after the campaign has been finished. Survival is addicting as it only can be.

Before you'll read the rest of the review please bare in mind, that I like this game, so don't get too negative image from upcoming sentences. It's just thera are some problems that will start bothering you after 15+ hours in the agme. If you don't intend to play that long, stop reading and just buy it, especially for local coop.

Unfortunately game tends to be a bit annoying. After a while, I know which guns and perks will work and which will not. Since it is all random it may (and it repeatedly will!) screw you over. I'd like to explore more exotic guns and perks combinations, but the game simpli will not let me - because it is all random.

In the end I was hoping for a little bit more - like a mode with a bit of control over gun drop, or mechanic (perk?) that would allow it. Also, I think there should be sandbox mode since a lot of perks are not well described and also a lot of stuff doesn't work together at all (e.g. rockets don't seem to apply the poison bullet effect).

Overall, I think the game is great, but longevity is crippled by lack of improvements compared to the original game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995107487', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1681228285}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971812924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1629825522}
review: Seriously addicting fun for when you have some time to kill. Loved it back in 2003 and stil love it today, glad it came onto steam!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961441091', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 11933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1567949431}
review:
Played it a lot in 2003 and 2004, here are the pro/cons:

Pros:
+still fun
+after getting used to the new graphics its the old feeling&fun
+fair but challenging achievements that can be all reached (unlike Company of Heros 2 0.o = 700 Achievements) ;-]

Cons:
-2 Players on keyboard not possible anymore (requires gamepad)
-No relative movement like in the original
-Changed the way perks work (e.g. atomic bomb much weaker against split-spiders, fireperk is more independent from the current gun, how perks stack) Therefore different approaches to win a level are required.

Big no is that the Highscore is completely hacked like in 2003. Almost 12 years later they should have fixed that ^_^

However, the price is a ripoff. Just wait until it is reduced more than -50%. Then recommended :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198097159132', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1416762699}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066083312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1667762438}

~This is a rip-off.

Title should say say REMAKE is a huge font.
Until I started the game, I expected to play a game I know and like. But this is hardly the game it was.

UPD: Ok, to be honest, the game has been impoved a lot since that review and now it is as much (or more) fun than original Crimsonland

author: {'steamid': '76561198007409496', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1706244437}
review: This one is a fun little spectacle shooter. Fight increasingly challenging waves of vicious enemies in a blast of over-the-top violance. The trademark of Crimsonland is undoubtedly its giant selection of weapons as well as the randomness with which you get to use them. Defy OP because every piece is OP. And yet somehow you're going down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961397228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1420089929}
review:
Disapointed.. The game has all the elements to be a good twinstick shooter, but it's just lacking balance. The game itself is split up into questmode where you have to earn all your perks and guns.. Somewhat of a lazy way of lengthening the game lifetime, instead of actually focusing on the game modes themselves.
Once you've got all the guns and perks, you're all set! ..right? No..

The survival mode is much like the quest mode, in that there's an red thread going through most of the game. Being that there are hives spawning all across the board, and you've got to clear them out, else you'll be swarmed and die..
And the guns are just a major lackluster.. There's so many useless weapons, as in slow as **** to reload, or not a big enough clip.  So what this basically forces you to do is to start whichever level and gamemode you're on, until you get a gun that's decent enough.

But the red thread is impossible to avoid, and it'll catch up to you no matter what. And that's fine! It's just not fine when it happens in a matter of 5-7 mins.. No matter what! The hives constantly pour out more and more mobs, and eventually they overrun your pathetic little person.. and then you die. And this happens over and over again, really not differentiating the way in which you die. You always die of being overrun, about 5-7 mins into a game.
It almost feels like the game is forcing you to play it with 1 to 3 other people, completely killing the singleplayer experience.

So the AI mechanics are disapointing, the weapons are mostly disapointing.. What about the perks then? Surely they are the saving grace? Nope..
The perks are plentiful and very helpful (obviously), but they're as cryptic as hell. They pretty much all have lengthy descriptions and tryhard humor on them, and doesn't really help you get the right upgrade in the heat of battle.. Instead you have to pause, break immersion and ponder WTF this actually does to your character. And a lot of them are just plain stupid, like instantkilling you for a better "score"... Yeah, that's helpful! "Gotta get those points!" :P

All in all, the game isn't horrible, as it's got all the right elements and the right idea.. The execution just doesn't seem that well thought out. It doesn't seem tested enough somehow. It's very short lived and anticlimactic when you've died for the 30th time to the same damn problem.
It just makes me want to play Nation Red instead.. Maybe not a fair comparison as this is an indie dev and all, but that's like saying "don't judge an Early Access game as a complete game". It's in the same genre, so I'm gonna.

So yeah, if you want a real solid twinstick shooter, try Nation Red.. Atleast they got it right and let's you play for more than 5 mins at a time. The game has a lot going for it, but it doesn't seem like it's ever going to change. Can't really recommend it at all, for more than a 3-4 hr fun time-killer. It doens't really have much replayability once you've gotten all the unlocks really.. hard difficulty is fine, but impossible is not. Buy at your own risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033837051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1417956841}
review: Отличная игра, которая переиздана для Steam. С того момента игра сильно не изменилась, за исключением случайного выпадания перков и оружия. Всё это безусловно усложняет игровой процесс, но сама игра не становится от этого менее привлекательной. В любом случае, если вам нравятся подобные аркадные игры с отстрелом монстров, то её могу однозначно рекомендовать. Для желающих померятся скиллами есть доска лидеров, что даст игре дополнительное игровое время.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985423936', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1416414310}
review:
Ta gra była już świetna dobre kilka lat temu jak nie kilkanaście :) Zremasterowana wersją wyszła super, wspomnienia z dzieciństwa powróciły :) Ostatnio zagrywałem się w nią do 6 rano i nie żałuje ani jednej minuty spędzonej z tą grą.
Dla tych którzy są niezdecydowani zostawiam link do playlisty z tej gry na moim kanale YT:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2wNP00L_35FTRfSeR2KN_tWJo4myzrsB

author: {'steamid': '76561198014198995', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 1812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1697211014}
review:
The game is greatly improved from its release. Also, 2003 version is available as a launch option. This is one of the best games about fighting a swarm/huge crowd of enemies that behave differently.
Music is absolutely great and fitting to the action on screen, scripted levels are interesting and difficult, and survival modes are varied and great to do.
It has only a local co-op, but that's because the technology is not there yet to display hundreds of enemies for two players at the same time and calculate their behaviors.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992183200', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1655016029}
review:
This is a lazy bland and overpriced rehash of the original. Even the greenlight gave the impression that the author wished to cop-out with this game with only the addition of local co-op.

However, if the price drops for the holidays or you pick this up on a Humble Bundle, definitely pick it up, play through the boring quests as quickly as possible as the survival mode is still entertaining. Unfortunately though, the old classic game played fair better and was a lot more fun and ultimately I wish the author copped out completely and just reserved us the old title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062010409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1426445425}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041005596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1415591488}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981635470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1622831694}
review:
I first got this game in 2003, and it is the same timeless classic it was then, as it is now. Top-down shooting action, with a highly addictive atmosphere and gameplay style; very reminiscent of Smash TV and Gauntlet.

If you enjoyed either of those games from those eras, you'll enjoy this. It's everything Smash TV always wanted to be and more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059106865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1585474316}
review:
I used to play this game almost non-stop when I was younger, but this remake is like knowing that Danereys Targaryen was 13 when she was married off to Khal Drogo - it's wrong.

EDIT: I decided to give it another shot. And it has been improved greatly. It's just like the old crimsonland, but with better graphics.

It takes me back to endless hours of playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965827217', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1509123599}
review:
I was fan of the original. And this is just as good: lovely range of perks,guns, modes, variety of gameplay of the quests.
Only drawback is the graphics could have been a bit better for a revamp. But still it's excellent. Worth getting on sale,and if this had online coop it'd be godly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050663352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1414958682}
review: игра уаще просто

author: {'steamid': '76561197999678072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1670576994}
review:
I grew up on the old Crimsonland and it showed me how good top-down shooters can be.
The improved graphics and updated UI make a much more clean and modern look for the old classic.
Removing perks in quests made them a little harder but I feel I accomplished more and improved my general skills without them.

Crimsonland is more about survival mode anyway, enjoying the well-crafted mechanics of the game and shooting up lots of monsters, painting the land crimson.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971483334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1644961364}
review:
It's a game you can jump right into and spend a few minutes playing or waste a few hours. Simple, bloody and brutal.

If you're here because it you played the older version, this one is just as good. Some people brought up 'no perks in quest mode', but that can be changed by typing G-R-I-M in the Esc menu to bring up the option to turn it on,

Good stuff..

author: {'steamid': '76561197994480308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1451759680}
review:
About as basic as top-down twin stick shooters can get. Predictable weapons, no maps (just one big empty field), mostly identical monsters. Perks are similarly dry - +damage, +defense, etc. 

Though this was a pioneer of the genre, its best days are far behind it. Not even nostalgia could make me play this for more than a half hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055873871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1701145420}
review:
Upd.: Разработчики верки в квестах вернули. Теперь хоть играть можно. Но оригинал все равно был лучше в плане дизайна. Примечательно что и через полтора года выходят какие-то обновления.
Old:Первая часть была лучше. Если об игре не слышали, то берите. Если играли в нее, то покупать не советую - эта версия хоть и обзавелась несколькими новыми фичами и чуть-чуть прибавила в графике, но и убавила в дизайне, геймплее и  склонилась к консольству(даже на PC кооператив только на одном компьютере и только с 3 геймпадами+одна клавомышь, никакой сетки нет). Сложилось впечатление, что разраб решил поплнить финансы старым тайтлом., но даже скопировать старое плохо удалось.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970485058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1582651098}
review: I have been playing this game since 2003, it is AWESOME. It's simple, but very fast paced. It is a good "Trainer" for many other games. If you can pass this game on the highest levels, you can be good at any other game. It forces you to strategize, think on your feet, split second decisions which can be the difference between a good time and a fast death. I honestly do not understand the negative reviews, this is a must get game. Maybe not at the 15$ CAD price, because it is much over a decade old, but when it's on sale, yes. GET IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983728653', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1414850088}
review:
Crimsonland

До сих пор помню, как я играл в эту игру, а точнее демоверсию, в детсве. Тогда она казалась необычно крутой - много оружие, бесконечные орды монстров, куча кровищи, прокачка персонажа. Это версия немного отличается от той, что продавалась в прошлом. Добавлены новые забавные режимы, немного оружия, поправлен баланс. Интересно ли в неё играть сегодня? В целом да, механика по-преженму весёлая - многочисленные монстры появляются на карте и вам надо их всех убивать.

Игра стоит своих денег, а со скидкой не стоит раздумывать и брать.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197989926114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1688317252}
review: Старый-добрый Crimsonland с графоном, новыми пушками, врагами и перками. Великолепен как и всегда.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961409540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1416226561}

review: ООООООО ДА! Это ремейк самой затягивающей игры начала второго тысячелетия. Тут даже нечего сказать всем кто любит crimsonland обязательна к покупке,всем не знакомым-к ознокомлению. И да,мировой рейтинг решает,

author: {'steamid': '76561197983271717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1447615576}
review: This game is tons of fun. If you liked Dawn of War Last Stand mode and arcade shooters, this game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050495772', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1448481069}
review:
- Addictive gameplay.
- Lots of levels, weapons and game modes.
- Lots of Perks and powerups.
- Nice Top-down 2D graphics.
- Unique sounds and nice metal soundtracks.
- Up to 4 Player Local Coop.
- Runs without a single lag on my laptop which has a first generation integrated (Intel HD Graphics).
- Easy to play, hard to master.

It would have been better if there was an online Co-op option to connect anyone across the net, a base defense game mode would have been great too, and some extra maps to choose before we begin the survival game mode, but overall Crimsonland is a good and fun game.

I recommend this game to anyone who likes survival and top-down shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038310096', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1414257048}
review:
Crimsonland.

Its old.
Its classic.
Its updated.


I remember as i played Crimsonland YEAAAAARRRSSSS ago but anyhow, this "version" doesnt play like the ones i played or remember. So its kind of a "UPDATED" version.

Still Crimsonland is a hardcore Arenashooter you can (now) play with 3 friends at one PC. It makes a lot of fun and the Difficult is also very nice, not unfair.

A must-have title for people who like hardcore gaming and even more for people who like arenashooter....or just for some childhood memories~

author: {'steamid': '76561198153945804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1602264956}
review:
Олдфаг данной игры. Играл еще в первые версии, где из оружия был только автомат  и десяток квестов без хардкора. Достойный, годный ремейк, одназначный вин, брать обязательно и не слушать товарищей с отзывами типа "кримсонлэнд не тот, все испортили...". Гон полнейший. Просто есть тип людей, которые никогда никаких перемен не принммают, особенно если дело касается чего то очень старого и любимого. А смотря адекватно, игра хороша.

Мясца больше, оружия больше и так же подтянули убойность некоторых старых пушек, в квесты добавили главу и в целом они стали сложнее. Отсутствие перков в квесте по-моему ни разу не потеря, только добавляет сложности, а собсвенно и интереса, в конце концов можно включить их в настройках. Графон подтянули, по меню вопросов нет. Часто говорят, мол приблизили камеру, карту не видно. Вранье. Все так же как в 2004 когда мы играли на мониторах 3:4 с неблльшим разрешением. Дизайн в игре сначала пугает, спустя час понимаешь, что так удобнее, ибо сколько раз мы умирали в классическом крайме, смотря в углы широкоформатного экрана, дабы посмотреть на эту тонюсенькую полоску жизни, вообщем со временем дизайн оценится по достоинству. Игра 10/10, как говорится- то же самое, но на 20% круче!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041124888', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1480021179}
review:
Оригинальная игра вышла почти десятилетие назад - в 2003 году. Для меня, как и для многих тогда, игра была условно бесплатной. В то время диск с сотней казуальных и аркадных развлечений стоил около ста рублей. И среди разных вариаций тетриса, арканоида и зумы, мне посчастливилось наткнуться на игру, которая нещадно высасывала мое время, которое я должен был тратить на выполнение домашней работы.

Десять лет я ждал перезапуска игры. За это время я успел закончить школу, заняться первым нелепым подростковым сексом и даже немного определиться в жизни. И вот, в 2013 году, на площадке Steam Greenlight появилась страничка долгожданной игры. А еще через год я начал проводить ночи, не смыкая глаз и прорубаясь через орды пауков, зомби, ящериц, инопланетян и непонятно-кого-еще.

Сама по себе, игра не привносит каких-то особенных техник или необычного геймплея. Это обычный 2D-шутер с видом сверху, где все, что требуется от игрока - бегать и стрелять под тяжелую музыку. Монстры респаунятся всегда в одних и тех же местах, и проходя один и тот же уровен в сотый раз, вы будете знать, в какое время и на каком участке появится медлительные зомби, а в каком смертоносные маленькие красные крабы, но эти знания никак не спасут вас он неминуемой гибели.

Хардкорность в Crimsonland такая же вымышленная и бессмысленная, как в Dark Souls. То есть без нее вполне можно было бы обойтись, но тогда у игры не было бы фанатов. И это развлечение вряд ли увлекло кого-нибудь больше, чем на один вечер.

Итак, вкратце о сюжете - его нет. Ну то есть вообще нет никакого сюжета. Вы - человек, который должен отстреливаться от орд монстров и это никак не объясняется. Непонятно на своей ли вы планете или на чужой. Непонятно откуда эти монстры взялись. А с кем вы сражаетесь можно только догадываться, если читать названия уровней. И эта бессюжетность - она просто идеально вписывается в игру. Думаю, что именно сюжет погубил серию Serious Sam. Я серьезно.

Игра в обычном режиме представляет из себя шесть глав, в каждой по десять "квестов". Суть каждого квеста заключается в уничтожении всего, что может двигаться. По ходу прохождения, вы будете открывать новое оружие, новые перки, новые уровни для игры на выживание (ну и если мамка дала денег на лицуху в стиме, то и ачивки).

Но в режиме квестов вы не почувствуете всю боль, которую разработчики приготовили для хардкорных игроков. Даже уровень сложности Grim (самый высокий) не сравнится с игрой в режиме выживания.

Только в режиме выживания у вас получится воспользоваться перками. В Crimsonland перк - это аналог пассивных умений из RPG. Перки бывают разной упоротости от урановых пуль и пироманьячности (когда вы обжигаете врагов, находящихся в интимной близости) и до неотвратимой смерти через 30 секунд, но зато очков заработаете вдвое больше.

Режимов выживания четыре штуки. В классическом (survival) вы просто убиваете монстров, меняете оружие, набираете опыт, начиняете своего бойца перками и так, пока персонаж не погибнет. А в режиме выживания он обязательно погибнет. Rush-режим ограничивает нас одним типом оружия - штурмовой винтовкой, в остальном он схож с survival. Weapon Picker предоставляет нам невероятно много оружия на карте, но с одним условием: одна пушка - одна обойма. Закончились патроны? Ищи новое оружи или умри. Nukefism вообще лишает нас оружия. единственный способ уничтожить врагов - подбирать Nuke-бонусы, которые взрывают противников в небольшом радиусе от игрока. Ну и blitz - это survival на повышенных скоростях.

В версии 2003 года был режим выживания, когда игрок стоял на месте, а на него шли монстры с именами. Чтобы убить монстра необходимо было ввести его имя. Но, видимо, из-за выхода игры на консолях, от этого режима пришлось отказаться. Зато теперь мы можем играть на геймпаде и в кооперативе до четырех человек.

Эта игра подойдет, владелецам консолей, у которых много друзей, а спортивные симуляторы поднадоели. Или если вы одинокий гик, чурающийся всего живого, и страдающий от недостатка хардкорных игр. Другим категориям людей не дано понять всей прелести Crimsonland.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970802842', 'num_games_owned': 2887, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1516827546}
review:
Let's start with the most important thing. This IS FINALLY CRIMSONLAND.

I wrote a review of this game a year and a half ago about this game being a bad update of the original. It took them a while, but the developers have finally fixed my issues with the game, and so I can say, with 100% certainty, this is the game I wanted (and thought I was buying in the first place.) Great job, guys. This makes me happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005896561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1413202235}
review:
Original Crimsonland (2004) is one of my most favourite games ever. But the Steam version is a serious step backwards. New graphics are not as pretty, new UI is bland and forgettable, and the worst crime of all - the Perks are gone from the quest mode. That's right, they only exist in Survival, which I know some people don't even play.

You would be much better suited by playing the original version 1.9.8.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966853942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1462744792}

UPDATE 4/24/16: so the dev reached out to me (comments) and they tweaked things in such a way that you have more opportunity to get to power-ups on the harder difficulties and even the playing field a little bit, not nearly as dependent on RNG and luck while still being a huge challenge...i just played all the way through the Grim difficulty and feelsgoodman.jpg

that said, this game is freakishly addictive (even when i wasn't happy with it two years ago) and is highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198132758732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1521849813}
review:
UPDATE: The game now DOES feature the classic mode. Which in my opinion is the only mode you should play. I'll leave the review as is other than some rewording and change the negative to a positive since they DO allow you to play the classic version which is still super fun. 
However my opinion on modern mode still stands since after playing it recently again, not too much has been fixed. It still gets hard way too fast and doesn't let you really enjoy it too much. However thanks a lot to 10Tons for reaching out and attempting to fill the gap with the classic version.

The modern version of this game has a lot going for it...but not enough.


Lets start with the positives:

I love the updated graphics, the new perks, the more streamlined leveling system, the ability to have four players at once, and many other details about this reboot of the classic crimsonland. Killing enemies is as fun as ever and almost every weapon is great and feels good for different situations (except you blowtorch!) and has a legitimate strategy. Perks are incredibly important and add a deep aspect of thought to the game (Do I get regeneration to keep my health up or choose fast reloader so I can kill enemies more?) and the sheer addictive nature of the gameplay will keep you hooked. Its a solid title...or should be...

Which leads me to the negatives:

Outside of the story mode this game isn't really as fun as it used to be. They took out a lot of things that made it fun. In solo survival the average player can expect to get to level 8-9 if they get a decent weapon before being absolutely annihilated by the hordes of enemies. If you add friends to the mix the difficulty ramps up even more and you will be lucky if you clear level 6. Its almost a broken level of hard. Theres no fighting it. No matter which perks you pick or which weapons you have the survival mode reaches a certain point early on that just immediately kills you. 

Your choices feel useless and it becomes kind of a drag when you get the perfect weapon combo with the perfect perks and then you just get slaughtered anyways by the sudden wave of splitting spiders and zombie lords that surround you out of thin air instead of coming out of the sides of the screen like they used to. The previous version of crimsonland slowly spiked the difficulty more and more making the survival last longer. It really felt like you were, you know, surviving? 

This version of crimsonland has no such subtlety or flair. They let you gain a couple levels and then just murder you outright with a frustrating amount of enemies that are impossible to fight. Let me put it to you this way. I was the 3rd highest ranking player IN THE WORLD in the previous crimsonland but in this one I can barely top level 10 in solo survival. They have taken one of the greatest and most fun modes of the game and just smashed it and made it unplayable. If they had a difficulty choice I think it could mitigate this. This is the only game I think actually NEEDS an easy mode.

Another thing that is absolutely broken in this game is the enemy spawning system. In the previous crimsonland enemies came out of all 4 sides of the screen giving you a chance to plan ahead. You could see a horde of zombies and decide which way you want to bait them to try and get an opening to dive for that powerup or weapon. You can find the big monster that is spawning little ones and put that sucker down before he overwhelms you.

This crimsonland has destroyed that too. It is quite common now to have enemies spawn on top of you and immediately kill you. Nothing sucks worse than to be 10 minutes into a boss battle and to be killed by a horde of tiny red aliens spawning right on top of you. Or to be doing a survival round with your favorite weapon and perks and to have a lizard king spawn right next to you and one shot you instantly. Its painfully frustrating and can make you want to chuck your keyboard across the room. It has happened to me in almost every mission of this game and is the most common way to die. Some enemies still come out of the sides of the screen, but more than half of them just appear with a flash wherever they feel like regardless of how inconvient it is for you.

So in conclusion, the game is fun but ultimately frustrating and not worth your money. They could have had a solid remake of a fun arcade shooter on their hands but they've instead destroyed it by breaking the difficulty and spawning and made it virtually unplayable. If you do buy this game, you'll discover its fun palls rather quickly because of its major stumbling blocks. It is a shadow of its former self and if you want to play a fun arcade shooter, ONLY play the classic version of this game and ignore the inferior modern mode.

Play the classic mode. That part is fun, but skip the modern version. Its just not fun anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071810195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 17574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4381, 'last_played': 1620421345}
review:
I enjoy this style of game, so, overall, I've had fun with Crimsonland. However, there were some really badly missed opportunities with this game. For example, can somebody please explain why in the hell you earn buffs (faster reload, faster running speed, increased damage, increased xp gain, increased power-up drops etc.) if you can never activate any of them in the quest game mode. Who cares if you can use them in survival mode, I want to beat all the levels on every difficulty setting, but, quite frankly, without being able to use a buff or two, beating many of those levels once you get to Hardcore and beyond depends entirely on what your first weapon drop is. By the time a second weapon drops so many baddies have spawned that getting to a specific spot is next to impossible, you're just in full on kite mode. Not only that but your character moves slower than many of the enemies and is slowed briefly by taking damage, meaning one hit equals death in most cases because the brief pause allows the hoard to overtake you. Perfect time to activate the faster run buff you unlocked, but no, it's worthless. C'mon guys, with a few minor adjustments, this could be a real good time.

***WOOT!!! Thanks for putting the buffs in the quest mode. That was my one complaint. Also I really enjoy the type mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000943979', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1529594511}
review:
I should start with a couple of things: 

1) I do recommend this game. But it's not a very strong recommendation. 
2) My decision to purchase was largely nostalgia-driven. 

Those two caveats disclosed, my review is relatively simple. This is a fun top-down shooter that is a bit stuck in the past. It's a game that for me, back in 2003, was a pretty big deal for something that today would fall into a much more competitive indie genre. The basic premise is: you're a guy, you run around in circles, you shoot things and they bleed. Eventually you're going to die, but along the way you can level up to gain perks which propels the arcadey gameplay.

The game is effectively untouched except in superficial, and relatively inconsequential ways. It really needs much more than that to be anything but a game people like me are willing to purchase because they have fond memories of playing. You can use modern resolutions now! The UI is updated (but it's bland)! But that's about it. Effectively, this is a PC game from 2003 ported to a PC platform of 2014.

The gameplay is still fun. But the asking price, and the lack of change and balance to the game over the course of a decade is unlikely to bring in much of an audience beyond people who played Crimsonland prior to its launch on Steam.

I wanted very much to see some new game modes, some new weapons, some new perks, some new something. But really, I have the same game on a new computer with a new UI. Pretty unimpressive.

On sale, this game is worth the time and money I think. Though it's very hard to make the case for something old that isn't doing much to take advantage of a huge sea change in what a game can be, and what the PC platform is able to do. I was happy to buy the game hoping against hope that maybe some additional content will be added, or Steam Workshop integration will come along. Though I doubt that is likely, and I doubt you'll feel as nicely as I do about this game, I think you can still have a good weekend's worth of fun if you give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007563962', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1531162723}
review:
Однажды я уже попробовала написать обзор на старый добрый кримс и, надо признать, несколько погорячилась, потому что давно ждала какого-нибудь обновления, этакой весточки об игре. Хотелось чего-то нового, но в реалиях этой игры, поэтому мне и захотелось поиграть в ремейк. 
Я помню те времена, когда в кримсе было только четыре главы и по-настоящему хардкорным считалось пройти 4.10 на второй сложности. Помню времена, когда небезызвестный русский сайт публиковал свои рекорды на время, поскольку в онлайн-таблице было много читеров, а результаты с отрицательным временем, как, например, в 2.10 (видела я там рекорд с ракетной батареей в -52 секунды, и это было круто, я вам доложу), игра попросту не учитывала в качестве рекорда.
И этот кримс совершенно не такой. Начать стоит хотя бы с того, что система перков претерпела значительные изменения. Дело даже не в том, что перки в кампании теперь включается с помощью спецкода (хотя, надо признать, и в этом тоже), а в том, что они теперь сродни обязаловке. Чуть только происходит повышение - и повышаться необходимо. То есть, фишка старой версии с экономией 1 перк=1 секунда, больше не котируется. На этой системе перков была завязана основная фишка - дружеское (и не обязательно дружеское) соперничество, присущее игре, когда, к пример, лишним неиспользуемым перком по времени выигрывался уровень, скажем, 2.8, с гнёздами. 
Сюрвайвал претерпел похожие изменения и стал куда более сложен (быть может, дело просто в изменённой системе начисления очков). Это не тот плюс, которого ждали от игры, поскольку после определённой отметки жить в сюре можно было только за счёт удачно подобранных бонусов и правильной экипировки (оружие+перки на него). Жизненно важный телекинез стал полным отстоем, рассчитанным, видимо, на консольную версию и просто подтягивающим любые (даже нафиг не нужные) бонусы прямиком к вам. Выпала газовая горелка, когда у вас в руках плазмошотган, джекхаммер или разделитель? Это никого не интересует - либо берите, либо убегайте от бонуса, кусаемые толпами мобов. 
Многие полезные перки и связанные с ними баги, пофиксили. Это фикс, к примеру, с ракетной батареей и столь любимая игроками связка Pulse Gun + Angry Reloader. 
Сюжетка приобрела одну новую главу (по сравнению с последним обновлением), которую сделали пятой, а бывшую пятую оттеснили на место шестой (было бы странно, если бы 6.10 по эпичности хоть что-то превзошло). 
На деле же получается, что сюжетку на всех уровнях сложности (если включить перки с помощью "grim") можно пройти за пару дней, ещё пару дней поиграть в сюр и другие режимы, попутно обалдевая с количества читерастов в таблицах. В итоге - совершенно не то, что было раньше. Что понравилось мне - так это лишняя глава сюжетки, да новое оружие вроде гаусс-минигана. 
В целом, конечно, нельзя сказать однозначно, что игру испортили. Оказуаливают сейчас многие игры, но вот то, что под раздачу попал и любимый когда-то игроками Crimsonland - печально.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003746163', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1492492300}
review:
Затягивающая игра!

Сразу скажу, что играл в классическую версию много лет назад, и купил эту игру в Steam сразу же, как только увидел её. И не пожалел.

Толпы монстров набегают со всех сторон, никаких укрытий и регенерации. Во время игры из монстров падает случайное оружие, с которым приходится провести большую часть времени на уровне. Это сильно увеличивает реиграбельность игры из-за того, что каждое прохождение не похоже на предыдущее, каждый раз другая тактика. Бывает, что выпадает какая-нибудь пукалка и бегаешь с надеждой, что скоро выпадет другое оружие.

Правда, в режиме квеста не хватает перков, которые были в классической игре. Они вносили ещё больше разнообразия и всегда были случайными. Здесь они тоже есть, но только в режимах выживания. Перки дают игроку уникальные способности типа лазерного прицела к оружию или возможности убить всех монстров на карте, если сам умер.

Отличная игра для рабочего места, так как не требует глубокого погружения и достаточно легко играется, при этом имея отличную реиграбельность и доставляя массу удовольствия от убийства каждого монстра.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977724919', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1575595315}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050446493', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1420777270}
review: If you like twin stick shooters, I wholeheartedly reccomend this game. There are a ton of weapons to pick from (albeit some much better than others), perks that change up the gameplay, and 4 player local support. Although the quest mode is short (my first run-through took me about 2 and a half hours), it may as well be the tutorial as it introduces you to every enemy type over time and unlocks all of the weapons/perks for use in survival mode. My particular favorite mode is blitz, which is basically normal survial mode on fast forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996138531', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1706772609}
review: man... you guys gotta play this twin stick shooter (in the vain Robotron 2084 and Smash TV) sure, you see it now and think "it looks like another stupid mobile game" well when it came out, it was all the buzz in the freeware pc gaming community then made some more waves when it went to share ware. it's simple and nothing terribly special, but it's lots of fun, satisfying weapons, lots of power ups that keep wanting more just to see what else comes to attack you and how you can mow down hoards of enemies. it was one of my favorites as 13 year old and it was the first M rated game i ever played so i got mad respect for 10 Tons and Crimsonland will always have a place in my heart. a small place, but i can't deny it. it's fricken there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011435134', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1419916836}
review:
Changes from Original
- More weapons and Powerups to pick
- More game mode like Blitz or Nuke
- Grim Difficulty
- Normally perks disable in Story Mode but later you can customize by pause and type GRIM
- 4 Co-op players
- New Episode 6

Weakness
- Some issues has bugged like game crashed when started
- Monster Vision removed, let 3.4 Hidden Evil is almost impossible to No-Damage clear
- Friendly Fire cannot set in option, must customize by GRIM
- 1st quarter set of weapons is too useless when against final chapter but frequently dropped

Overall
    One of my best choices to play killing swarms of alien although leveling affects stage to stage (not like Alien Shooter Vengeance that leveling affects all game), it compensates by 4 Co-op players which isn't found in Alien Shooter and besides story and survival, more modes acquire by ending whole story, increase interesting such as Type'O'Shooter, Rush, Blitz, Weapon Picker and Nuke.

Suggestion
- Add internet co-op player mode for oversea playing
- Fix crash issue in Windows 8
- New original tunes
- Ion weapons need more improvements although they can be upgraded by Ion Master (Original one is powerful enough to fight in late chapters)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005143507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1498799406}
review: I was skeptical at first but it is more fun than I expected.  What it does, it does well.  It can be pretty difficult at times, but there is a pretty fun variety of weapons and they behave quite differently.  There is nothing more satisfying than picking up a power up and mowing down the enemy just as you were about to get overwhelmed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044081373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1460064233}
review:
An HD remake of a lesser known gem; Crimsonland Classic (included with GOG version). Most of my review comes from the GOG (DRM-free) version of Crimsonland, so my Steam stats don't reflect my overall playtime with this game.

PROS:
+ Fun, twin-stick, arcade gameplay.
+ Easy to pick up, difficult to master.
+ RPG-like perks system.
+ Plays with both mouse & keyboard and Xinput (360) controllers.
+ Includes 2-4 player co-op.
+ LOW hardware requirements; a NETBOOK can run Crimsonland.
+ Mac and Linux versions are now included.

CONS:
- No online multiplayer...yet.
- Graphics snobs will take issue with Crimsonland's 1990s arcade style graphics.

Note:
Available DRM-free with Steam key on Humble Store (how I'd gotten the Steam version). GOG version is DRM-free and includes Crimsonland Classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1446549688}
review:
A non-biased 2nd look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FwbfEPNCwkc

Playing this game brought back a flood of memories and I couldn't figure out why. Then glancing across my retail games collection I noticed the box.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=39PPl-nyTW4

Yes I still have the original retail 'boxed' version. This is one of the best top-down survival horde modes you can get. It never gets old. If you like old school top down, twin stick shooters like 'Robotron' you'll love this! - Awesome game... Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032447372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1493, 'last_played': 1409394132}
review:
Basic idea of this 2D Arcade Top-Down Shooter, is, you run from baddies & shoot at them for as long as you can, then, they eat you alive.

You have good arsenal of weaponry at you disposal. Different mods of firearms, flamethrowers, plasma-ion-gauss toys, rocket launchers and some other weirdness. Most of them are quite playable and offer unique experience, but, some just really bad and get you killed very quickly :)

Enemies are not too diverse in form and even less then that in essence, but hey, they come in different colors !!! Nevertheless, while number of enemies will usually be your biggest concern, towards some of them you'll develop quite special feelings ...

And also there are powerups, popping-up all over the place. Not too important at first, but later, picking them up in right order (or just being lucky) is pretty much the only way to finish a campaign level.

Oh yeah, different play modes, campaign, survival, co-op and some other joyful ways to experience inevitable death ... Survival is arguably most interesting one, though, honestly, I've enjoyed it more in original game. Now, 6 to 7 perks per game is not too much to go by.

There isn't much to say about graphics or sounds (thanks god days when those were important are gone), but overall gameplay is awesome, game is addictive as hell !!!

Enjoy, don't forget to order a T-shirt ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004391513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3293, 'last_played': 1414447805}
review:
I did play the original and I really like the fact that the game has been moved to HD format. I played a hell out of it and I think it is safe to say that story only begins after the campaign has been finished. Survival is addicting as it only can be.

Before you'll read the rest of the review please bare in mind, that I like this game, so don't get too negative image from upcoming sentences. It's just thera are some problems that will start bothering you after 15+ hours in the agme. If you don't intend to play that long, stop reading and just buy it, especially for local coop.
 
Unfortunately game tends to be a bit annoying. After a while, I know which guns and perks will work and which will not. Since it is all random it may (and it repeatedly will!) screw you over. I'd like to explore more exotic guns and perks combinations, but the game simpli will not let me - because it is all random.

In the end I was hoping for a little bit more - like a mode with a bit of control over gun drop, or mechanic (perk?) that would allow it. Also, I think there should be sandbox mode since a lot of perks are not well described and also a lot of stuff doesn't work together at all (e.g. rockets don't seem to apply the poison bullet effect).

Overall, I think the game is great, but longevity is crippled by lack of improvements compared to the original game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022292984', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1659361763}
review:
I've been playing Crimsonland pretty much since its original release, and it was a total time killer at the time. Obviously, I was quite hyped when I heard about the updated version on Steam. And I have to say that I am quite disappointed with it. 

The HD graphics are just... meh. Sure, it is in high resolution, and new level backgrounds look nice, but everything else looks like garbage from year 2000. Really, the old version just had better overall design. The new monster graphics are ugly, the weapon icons are beyond any recognition, and the new UI is not just ugly, but it is also less usable. It is virtually impossible to determine how much of your Shield is left when surrounded by enemies, and it is also very hard to determine the exact time left in reloading (why not just leave the clear and accurate "clock" from the old version?).

The game is now released on many platforms. Usually, there is nothing wrong with that, but for Crimsonland it meant that some content was removed because it was unusable on consoles. I really miss the Typ'o'Shooter mode, and some perks like Pyrokinetic and Evil Eyes. 
Speaking of perks: the new Telekinetic is just garbage. Instead of allowing you to hover the crosshair over the powerup and wait for a few seconds, ALL powerups are now gravitated towards you even when you really don't need that. Ever wanted to lose the game because a mysterious force made you pick up the Blowtorch? Well, now you can. Say thanks for consoles for one more butchered PC game.
I was also really disappointed by having perks disabled in Quests mode by default. Sure, one can say it is more challenging that way, but I've always perceived Quests as an extended tutorial for Survival mode, where player unlocks the perks and tries them out. Without the perks, the difficulty becomes just absurd on Grim, and the luck factor starts to account on your success way more that your skill. Why not just make an achievement for finishing the game without the perks? I believe that'd have been the best of both worlds for both hardcore and usual gamers. 

Some quite significant changes to the game balance were also made. And while I appreciate the new way Fire Bullets powerup works, I will never understand why rockets weapons are THAT powerful now, and why the almighty Splitter Gun is reduced to a useless garbage when compared to the old one. Still, the balance is better than it was in general, I think.

I really dislike new Survival mode. You can barely get 6-9 levels if you are really good (and lucky), and that really limits your chances of survival. The game session is also much shorter now, as monsters gain power and health much quicker than before. I miss the old epic 1+ hour battles.

Online highscores are implemented really well and provide a lot of additional info that helps to identify cheaters.

In conclusion, Crimsonland is still a fun game. Not as fun as the old version for me, but if you are new to Crimsonland - just wait for the sale and go grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992622159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1407857617}
review:
Был очень рад увидеть эту игру в стиме. "НАКОНЕЦ-ТО!!!"- подумал я. Но разочарование наступило сразу же, как только я купил и запустил игру. Нет того меню, поменялся интерфейс, вокруг бойца теперь идиотский круг, показывающий количество его жизни. Все теперь выглядит как-то просто и напоминает старые игры 90-х годов. 
Так же, поменялась анимация монстров. Инопланетяне теперь выглядят ну настолько убого, что аж играть не хочется. 
Тем, кто не играл в старый, классический кримсонленд игра может и понравится, но тем, кто часами и днями напролет рубился в ТОТ САМЫЙ Crimsonland, эта игра вряд-ли покажется ее достойной. 
Очень жаль.

I was very glad, to see Crimsonland in STEAM. But I was dissappointed just after I had launched the game. Everything is different, from menu till animation of the monsters. The aliens are so different from original Crimsonland, that I just don't want to play this game.
Your hit points bar is not a bar anymore. Now, it's a... CIRCLE! A circle around your soldier! :facepalm:
Changes are so BIG that I'm already hate this game.
Those people, who haven't play the original game, may love this one. But all those, who had been playing Crimsonland earlier, won't like it. 
It's just my opinion. And I am very frustrated about what happened to the STEAM version of this GREAT game =(

author: {'steamid': '76561198060633041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3303, 'last_played': 1677228871}
review: эх...старый добрый crimsonland что с тобой сделали эти изверги из 10 tons...сотни часов проведеные за игрой я получал каждый раз море удовольствия от игры, особенно играя с другом на одной клавиатуре, а точнее друг на мышке я на клаве играя на хардкоре ложили монстров пачками...начну с картинки, внешне выглядит по сравнению со старой версией ужасно, просто отвратительно..старая картинка смотрится и по ныне гораздо лучше, в разы лучше чем новая...что сделали с перками это просто ужас, телекинетик стал каким то магнитом, который тянет ненужное оружие к тебе и не понятно становится от кого бежать от монстров или от притягивающегося к тебе пусьгана..вид урезали % на 40, зачем нужен перк eagle eye?? глупость какая то..какойто непонятный прицел стал, да еще около него кол-во потронов, зачем? за-чем!? вид перезарядки тоже убогий до ужаса я совершено не вижу когда там закончится перезарядка, работают просто старые инстинкты..некогда успешная игрушка при перенасыщенном рынке игр подобного жанра, имевшая успех, и любовь наверно миллионов игроков слита в унитаз разработчиками, ее любят только потому что играли в старую версию, не было бы например той старой версии, а допустим новая версия единственая, я бы даже и не стал смотреть на это убожество и прошел бы мимо, просто из за любви к старой версии играю и в эту..это какая то новая мода если старая игрушка была отличной нужно сделать какашку, вот вам возьмите и подавитесь, это просто тупо срубание денег на фанатах, за что разработчикам нужно забить гвоздь в голову..в целом поиграть можно, но сколько времени вы в ней проведете решать вам..я и по сей день играю в старую версию, потому что она лучше.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198056067731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1462, 'last_played': 1511146266}
review:
If you're looking for a top-down shooter, Crimsonland is your game of choice.

[u]Pros[/u]:
[list]
[+]Challenging
[+]Smart AI
[+]Replayability
[+]Good extras
[+]Decent variety of weapons
[+]Very fun when playing friends/a friend[/list]

[u]Cons[/u]:
[list]
[+]No story
[+]No armor
[+]No grenades
[+]Not able to use perks in quest mode[/list]

Would recommend to a friend, only if it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045354231', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1525095019}
review:
Знаете, одно из свойств классических игр - простота. Нет особого сюжета, есть превосходный геймплей. Хардкор, в основном из-за отсутствия сохранений и прочего облегчаещуего инвентаря. Помните Марио? Соника? Контру? Кто играл, до сих пор вспоминает с теплыми чувствами. А то и устанавливает эмулятор, расслабится, вспомнить былое.
 Вот что приходит на ум, когда хочу описать эту игру. Геймплей Контры (правда, со многими улучшениями) на одном месте. Никуда не бежим, только защищаемся, покрывая все вокруг реками крови. Прекрасная озвучка, что не приедается (только если не будете играть по 400 часов...). С ней давно уж знаком, но вот недавно набрел на нее в стиме.
 Прекрасный способ расслабится. Истребление орд монстров не хуже Мортал Комбата успокаивает. Советую игру всем.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978826785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1648923551}
